Entity-kg.label: KGs
Entity-kg.description: KGs refers to knowledge graphs, which are structured representations of information that enable the organization, integration, and retrieval of data through relationships between entities.

Entity-_arules.label: #Arules
Entity-_arules.description: #Arules refers to the average number of accurate rules mined from knowledge graphs, specifically those with an OPSC (Open Path Score) greater than 0.8.

Entity-rlvlr_algorithm.label: RLVLR algorithm
Entity-rlvlr_algorithm.description: The RLVLR algorithm is a computational method used for mining closed path rules in knowledge graph completion by employing a similarity scoring function to evaluate the quality of generated rules.

Entity-the_problem_of_active_knowledge_g.label: the problem of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC)
aliases: the problem of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC)
Entity-the_problem_of_active_knowledge_g.description: The problem of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC) refers to the challenge of generating relevant queries to identify and complete missing facts in a knowledge graph, rather than merely predicting specific missing facts.

mentions.local_name: the problem of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC)

Entity-100__precision.label: 100% precision
Entity-100__precision.description: 100% precision refers to the metric indicating that nearly all queries generated by the OPRL algorithm for the synthetic Poker knowledge graph accurately correspond to relevant missing facts in the test set, demonstrating the high relevance and accuracy of the generated queries.

Entity-parameter_(1).label: Parameter
Entity-parameter_(1).description: In the context of the OPRL algorithm for mining Open Path rules from a knowledge graph, 'Parameter' refers to user-defined inputs that specify the maximum length of the rules and the minimum acceptable scores for the quality measures OPSC and OPHC.

Entity-98_.description: The term '98%' refers to the precision achieved by Open Path (OP) rules in generating queries for knowledge graph completion, indicating that 98% of the generated queries are accurate.

Entity-_2__(1).description: The term (2) refers to the specific structure of an Open Path (OP) rule in the context of knowledge graph completion, which connects entities through a sequence of predicates while allowing for free variables.

Entity-k_.label: K'
Entity-k_.description: K' refers to a reduced fragment of a knowledge graph (KG) that is generated by the Sampling algorithm, consisting of a bounded number of entities related to a specific target predicate P.

Entity-reconstructing_the_kg.label: reconstructing the KG
Entity-reconstructing_the_kg.description: Reconstructing the KG refers to the process of using learned embeddings of entities and predicates to predict new facts and complete the knowledge graph.

Entity-incomplete.label: incomplete
Entity-incomplete.description: The term 'incomplete' refers to the state of enterprise and public Knowledge Graphs (KGs) that lack certain entities or information, indicating that they do not contain all the necessary data to be fully comprehensive.

Entity-opsc_threshold.label: OPSC threshold
Entity-opsc_threshold.description: The OPSC threshold is a parameter that determines the minimum quality required for rules generated by the Open Path Rule Learning (OPRL) algorithm to be considered valid for query generation in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-f_op__._.label: f_op(.)
Entity-f_op__._.description: f_op(.) refers to the open path fitness function, which estimates the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion by considering the product of predicate embeddings along a path and the average embeddings of entities at the endpoints.

Entity-unified_framework.label: unified framework
Entity-unified_framework.description: The 'unified framework' refers to a comprehensive system that integrates the OPRL method with a link predictor to enable fully automated completion of Knowledge Graphs.

Entity-these_entity.label: these entities
Entity-these_entity.description: These entities refer to the specific subset of entities extracted from a knowledge graph that are relevant to a target predicate, which are then used to form a reduced knowledge graph (KG) for the purpose of mining high-quality Open Path (OP) rules.

Entity-enterprise_kg.label: enterprise KG
Entity-enterprise_kg.description: An enterprise KG is a knowledge graph specifically designed to manage and represent data and relationships within a business context, facilitating data integration, analysis, and decision-making.

Entity-the_proposed_fitness_function.label: the proposed fitness function
Entity-the_proposed_fitness_function.description: The proposed fitness function is an embedding-based mechanism designed to efficiently estimate the quality of Open Path (OP) rules during their generation in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-co-occurrence_for_the_whole_rule.label: Co-occurrence for the whole rule
Entity-co-occurrence_for_the_whole_rule.description: Co-occurrence for the whole rule refers to a fitness function that quantifies the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion by aggregating the pairwise local co-occurrences of entities along the rule's path, thereby capturing the strength of connections between sequential entities based on their embeddings.

Entity-satisfying_fact.label: satisfying facts
Entity-satisfying_fact.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'satisfying facts' refers to the entities that fulfill the conditions of a given rule, particularly in the evaluation of open path (OP) rules, where the complexity arises from the larger number of such facts compared to closed rules.

Entity-kb.label: KB
Entity-kb.description: KB refers to the complete knowledge base from which relevant queries are induced using Open Path rules for the task of Active Knowledge Graph Completion (AKGC).

Entity-pathfinding___(1).label: PathFinding()
Entity-pathfinding___(1).description: PathFinding() is a function used in the OPRL algorithm to generate operational paths for constructing open path rules in knowledge graph completion by identifying sequences of predicates that connect entities related to a specified target predicate.

Entity-highly_relevant.label: highly relevant
Entity-highly_relevant.description: In the context of the paper, 'highly relevant' refers to queries generated by the OPRL algorithm that accurately target missing answer facts in the training set, demonstrating a high degree of precision in their relevance to knowledge graph completion.

Entity-this_kind_of_rule.label: this kind of rule
Entity-this_kind_of_rule.description: This kind of rule refers to closed path (CP) rules in rule-based knowledge graph completion, which are characterized by having no free variables and allowing for the inference of facts by universally quantifying all variables in the rule.

Entity-novel_heuristic_function.label: novel heuristic function
Entity-novel_heuristic_function.description: The term 'novel heuristic function' refers to an innovative computational method that utilizes embeddings learned by the RESCAL model to effectively mine Open Path (OP) rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-full_kb.label: full KB
Entity-full_kb.description: The term 'full KB' refers to a complete knowledge base that contains all the facts and entities relevant to a specific domain, which is utilized in the context of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC) to generate relevant queries based on mined Open Path rules.

Entity-overall_rule.label: overall rule
Entity-overall_rule.description: The 'overall rule' refers to a conceptual representation that encapsulates the latent features of a path connecting entities through a sequence of predicates in the context of Open Path rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-human-curated_maintenance_on_an_e.label: human-curated maintenance on an enterprise KG
aliases: human-curated maintenance on an enterprise KG
Entity-human-curated_maintenance_on_an_e.description: Human-curated maintenance on an enterprise KG refers to the process of manually overseeing and updating a knowledge graph used within an organization to ensure its accuracy, completeness, and relevance, particularly in the context of applying the OPRL method for active knowledge graph completion.

mentions.local_name: human-curated maintenance on an enterprise KG

Entity-missing_link.label: missing links
Entity-missing_link.description: In the context of Active Knowledge Graph Completion (AKGC), 'missing links' refer to the entities or relationships that are absent from a knowledge graph but can be inferred or queried using mined Open Path rules to enhance the graph's completeness.

Entity-embeddings__k__.label: Embeddings(K')
Entity-embeddings__k__.description: Embeddings(K') refers to the computed vector representations of predicates and arguments derived from a sampled fragment of a knowledge graph (K'), which are used to estimate the quality of open path rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-distribution.label: distribution
Entity-distribution.description: In this context, 'distribution' refers to the graphical representation of the mined rules categorized by their OPSC (Open Path Score) and length, illustrating the performance of the OPRL algorithm in learning rules from knowledge graphs.

Entity-opscophc_score.label: OPSC/OPHC scores
Entity-opscophc_score.description: OPSC/OPHC scores are metrics used to evaluate the quality of rules generated by the Open Path Rule Learning (OPRL) algorithm in the context of knowledge graph completion, specifically assessing their performance against full benchmark knowledge graphs.

Entity-scalekb.label: ScaleKB
Entity-scalekb.description: ScaleKB is a rule learning system that employs closed path (CP) rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-the_query_(1).label: the query
Entity-the_query_(1).description: The query refers to the specific questions or requests for information generated from a knowledge graph, particularly in the context of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC), where it is used to predict missing links based on learned Open Path rules.

Entity-a_different_application.label: a different application
Entity-a_different_application.description: The term 'a different application' refers to the distinct purpose of OP rules in knowledge graph completion, which is to generate relevant queries for new facts, contrasting with Closed rules that focus on completing the knowledge graph by answering queries.

Entity-a_closed_rule.label: a closed rule
Entity-a_closed_rule.description: A closed rule is a type of logical rule used in knowledge graph completion that allows for the inference of specific missing facts by ensuring that all variables in the rule's head are also present in its body, thereby preventing any existential quantification in the head.

Entity-induced_query.label: induced queries
Entity-induced_query.description: Induced queries refer to the relevant queries generated from knowledge graph facts using Open Path rules, which are designed to facilitate active knowledge graph completion by predicting potential missing links.

Entity-the_fact_in_the_kg.label: the fact in the KG
Entity-the_fact_in_the_kg.description: The fact in the KG refers to a specific piece of information or assertion that is represented within a knowledge graph, which may be incomplete or erroneous, and is the subject of prediction and inference in knowledge graph completion tasks.

Entity-each_p_i_and_p_t.label: Each P_i and P_t
Entity-each_p_i_and_p_t.description: Each P_i and P_t refers to predicates within a knowledge graph (KG) used in the context of open path (OP) rules for knowledge graph completion, where P_t represents the head predicate and each P_i represents the body predicates in the rule structure.

Entity-the_candidate_rule.label: the candidate rules
Entity-the_candidate_rule.description: The candidate rules refer to the set of potential Open Path (OP) rules evaluated for their effectiveness in completing a knowledge graph, specifically those that meet the criteria of having a support value OPsupp(r) greater than or equal to 1.

Entity-f_op.label: f_op
Entity-f_op.description: f_op is a mathematical function that estimates the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion by utilizing both entity and predicate embeddings.

Entity-open_path__opsupp__opsc__ophc.label: open path: OPsupp, OPSC, OPHC
Entity-open_path__opsupp__opsc__ophc.description: The term 'open path: OPsupp, OPSC, OPHC' refers to metrics used to evaluate the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion, specifically measuring the support, standard confidence, and head coverage of these rules.

Entity-co-occurrence_fitness_function.label: Co-occurrence Fitness Function
Entity-co-occurrence_fitness_function.description: The Co-occurrence Fitness Function is a statistical measure used to evaluate the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion by assessing the similarity of entity embeddings associated with predicates that co-occur in the rules.

Entity-opsc__r_.label: OPSC(r)
Entity-opsc__r_.description: OPSC(r) refers to the open path standard confidence metric, which quantifies the reliability of an open path rule in a knowledge graph by calculating the ratio of the number of entity pairs satisfying the rule's head to the number satisfying its body.

Entity-vast_kg.label: vast KGs
Entity-vast_kg.description: The term 'vast KGs' refers to large-scale knowledge graphs that contain extensive amounts of data and relationships, which pose challenges for existing embedding-based methods in terms of processing and analysis.

Entity-form__2_.label: form (2)
Entity-form__2_.description: The mention 'form (2)' refers to the specific structure of an Open Path (OP) rule used in the context of knowledge graph completion, which connects entities through a sequence of predicates and is defined in the paper to estimate local co-occurrence fitness.

Entity-f_co__._.label: f_co(.)
Entity-f_co__._.description: f_co(.) refers to a fitness function used in the OPRL algorithm for evaluating the quality of rules in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-relevance.label: relevance
Entity-relevance.description: In the context of the paper, 'relevance' refers to the quality of queries generated by the OPRL algorithm, specifically assessing whether these queries have answers present in the test set, thereby indicating their usefulness for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-two_system.label: two systems
Entity-two_system.description: The mention 'two systems' refers to the OPRL and RLvLR* algorithms used for query generation in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-four_benchmark_datasets.label: four benchmark datasets
Entity-four_benchmark_datasets.description: The 'four benchmark datasets' refer to FB15K SELECTED, YAGO2 core, Wikidata, and a synthetic Poker dataset, which are used to evaluate the performance of the OPRL algorithm in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-op_rule_variable_pattern.label: OP rule variable patterns
Entity-op_rule_variable_pattern.description: OP rule variable patterns refer to the specific sequences of predicates that are required to form the body of Open Path (OP) rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-question.label: questions
Entity-question.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'questions' refer to the actively generated inquiries derived from open path rules that aim to identify missing facts or entities within a knowledge graph.

Entity-degree_of_incompleteness.label: degrees of incompleteness
Entity-degree_of_incompleteness.description: The term 'degrees of incompleteness' refers to the varying levels of missing information or facts within Knowledge Graphs (KGs), which impacts the effectiveness of rule learning and query generation for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-query_about_potential_missing_fac.label: queries about potential missing facts
Entity-query_about_potential_missing_fac.description: Queries about potential missing facts refer to the relevant inquiries generated from open path rules in knowledge graph completion, aimed at identifying and addressing unknown missing facts within a knowledge graph.

Entity-r__p1__x__z0___p2__z0__z1___p3__z.label: r: P1(x,z0) ← P2(z0,z1) ∧ P3(z1,y)
Entity-r__p1__x__z0___p2__z0__z1___p3__z.description: The term 'r: P1(x,z0) ← P2(z0,z1) ∧ P3(z1,y)' represents an Open Path (OP) rule in the context of knowledge graph completion, where it defines a logical expression that specifies a relationship between entities based on the satisfaction of certain predicates.

Entity-varying_size_and_degree_of_incomp.label: varying sizes and degrees of incompleteness
aliases: varying sizes and degrees of incompleteness
Entity-varying_size_and_degree_of_incomp.description: The term 'varying sizes and degrees of incompleteness' refers to the different levels of missing information and structural gaps present in Knowledge Graphs (KGs), which can affect the complexity and effectiveness of rule learning and query generation for knowledge completion.

mentions.local_name: varying sizes and degrees of incompleteness

Entity-e_1.label: e_1
Entity-e_1.description: e_1 refers to an entity in the knowledge graph (KG) that is part of the body of an open path (OP) rule, which is used to determine relationships between entities based on predicates in the KG.

Entity-p5__z3__y_.label: P5(z3, y)
Entity-p5__z3__y_.description: P5(z3, y) is a predicate in the context of the rule extension process within the OPRL algorithm, representing a relationship between the entities z3 and y as part of generating open path rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-fitness_function_adapted_from_rlv.label: fitness function adapted from RLVLR
aliases: the fitness function adapted from RLVLR
Entity-fitness_function_adapted_from_rlv.description: The 'fitness function adapted from RLVLR' refers to a specific evaluation metric used in the context of the OPRL algorithm for assessing the quality of generated rules in knowledge graph completion, which has been improved upon by a novel hybrid fitness function introduced in the paper.

mentions.local_name: the fitness function adapted from RLVLR

Entity-minimum_opsc.label: minimum OPSC
Entity-minimum_opsc.description: minimum OPSC refers to a threshold parameter used in the OPRL algorithm to determine the minimum quality of Open Path rules for generating relevant queries in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-any_cp_rule.label: any CP rule
Entity-any_cp_rule.description: The term 'any CP rule' refers to closed path rules in knowledge graph completion, which are logical constructs that complete a knowledge graph by establishing relationships between entities through a defined path of predicates, but are less expressive than open path rules.

Entity-the_open_path_fitness_for_r.label: the open path fitness for r
aliases: the open path fitness for r
Entity-the_open_path_fitness_for_r.description: The open path fitness for r is a quality estimation function that evaluates the effectiveness of an open path rule by calculating the product of the predicate embeddings along the path, combined with the average embeddings of the entities at the endpoints, to represent the latent features connecting the entities in a knowledge graph.

mentions.local_name: the open path fitness for r

Entity-knowledge_graph_completion.label: knowledge graph completion
Entity-knowledge_graph_completion.description: Knowledge graph completion refers to the process of enhancing and filling in missing information within a knowledge graph by using various techniques and methodologies.

Entity-intriguing_challenge_for_future_w.label: intriguing challenges for future work
Entity-intriguing_challenge_for_future_w.description: The phrase 'intriguing challenges for future work' refers to the proposed extensions and improvements for the OPRL method, including learning more complex rules and integrating it with link predictors for enhanced automated knowledge graph completion.

Entity-poor_rule.label: poor rules
Entity-poor_rule.description: Poor rules refer to ineffective or low-quality rules in the context of knowledge graph completion that are identified and discarded early in the learning process using the OPRL algorithm.

Entity-p_t__x__z_0___p_1__z_0__z_1___p_2.label: P_t(x, z_0) ← P_1(z_0, z_1) ∧ P_2(z_1, z_2) ∧ ... ∧ P_n(z_{n-1}, y)
Entity-p_t__x__z_0___p_1__z_0__z_1___p_2.description: The entity mention 'P_t(x, z_0) ← P_1(z_0, z_1) ∧ P_2(z_1, z_2) ∧ ... ∧ P_n(z_{n-1}, y)' refers to an open path (OP) rule in knowledge graph completion, which expresses a logical relationship where the predicate P_t is derived from a sequence of predicates P_1 through P_n, allowing for the inference of queries based on the existence of certain relationships between entities.

Entity-the_number_of_fact_in_the_kg.label: the number of facts in the KG
aliases: the number of facts in the KG
Entity-the_number_of_fact_in_the_kg.description: The number of facts in the KG refers to the total count of distinct relationships or assertions represented within a knowledge graph, which is crucial for understanding its size and completeness.

mentions.local_name: the number of facts in the KG

Entity-query_p_t____e_.label: query P_t(?, e)
Entity-query_p_t____e_.description: The term 'query P_t(?, e)' refers to a specific type of query generated in the context of Active Knowledge Graph Completion (AKGC), where it represents a query with one free variable that can be induced from existing knowledge graph facts and Open Path rules, allowing for the inference of missing links with a quantifiable confidence degree.

Entity-process.label: process
Entity-process.description: The 'process' refers to the method of generating relevant queries from the learned Open Path (OP) rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-loop.label: loop
Entity-loop.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, a 'loop' refers to a closed path that consists of a single unbroken sequence of links connecting variables within a rule, allowing for the inference of new facts based on existing relationships in the knowledge graph.

Entity-pathfinding__k___p_t__p__a__k_.label: PathFinding(K', P_t, P, A, k)
aliases: Add PathFinding(K', P_t, P, A, k)
Entity-pathfinding__k___p_t__p__a__k_.description: PathFinding(K', P_t, P, A, k) is a function that generates candidate Open Path rules for a target predicate P by exploring paths in a reduced knowledge graph K' based on embeddings of predicates and arguments, with k representing the maximum length of the paths.

mentions.local_name: Add PathFinding(K', P_t, P, A, k)

Entity-the_intended_scope_of_kg.label: the intended scope of KGs
Entity-the_intended_scope_of_kg.description: The intended scope of KGs refers to the often ambiguous and inadequately specified boundaries within which knowledge graphs are expected to operate, leading to gaps in the representation of relevant entities and relationships.

Entity-our_target_language_for_learning.label: our target language for learning
Entity-our_target_language_for_learning.description: The term 'our target language for learning' refers to the formalism of Open Path (OP) rules, which are a type of existential rule used in the context of knowledge graph completion to derive relevant queries for identifying missing facts and entities.

Entity-highly_relevant_query.label: highly relevant queries
Entity-highly_relevant_query.description: Highly relevant queries refer to the specific queries generated by Open Path rules in the context of knowledge graph completion, aimed at soliciting missing facts and enhancing the accuracy of link prediction in incomplete knowledge graphs.

Entity-result_of_a_range_of_experiment.label: results of a range of experiments
aliases: the results of a range of experiments
results of a range of experiments
Entity-result_of_a_range_of_experiment.description: The phrase 'results of a range of experiments' refers to the findings and outcomes obtained from various experimental evaluations conducted to assess the performance and effectiveness of the proposed Open Path Rule Learning (OPRL) algorithm in the context of active knowledge graph completion.

mentions.local_name: results of a range of experiments
the results of a range of experiments

Entity-800_entity.label: 800 entities
Entity-800_entity.description: The mention '800 entities' refers to the maximum size limit set for each sample in the experiments conducted to evaluate the OPRL algorithm for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-minimum_opsc_and_minimum_sc_param.label: minimum OPSC and minimum SC parameters
aliases: minimum OPSC and minimum SC parameters
Entity-minimum_opsc_and_minimum_sc_param.description: The minimum OPSC and minimum SC parameters are thresholds used in the OPRL algorithm to filter and assess the quality of generated queries for knowledge graph completion, where OPSC refers to the minimum Open Path Score Confidence and SC refers to the minimum Score Confidence.

mentions.local_name: minimum OPSC and minimum SC parameters

Entity-relevant_query_(1).label: relevant queries
Entity-relevant_query_(1).description: Relevant queries refer to the queries generated by the OPRL algorithm that have answers present in the test set, indicating their significance for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-new_fact.label: new facts
Entity-new_fact.description: The term 'new facts' refers to the additional information or RDF triples that are inferred or predicted through the process of reconstructing a knowledge graph (KG) based on learned embeddings in representation learning.

Entity-a.label: A
Entity-a.description: A refers to a variable used in the PathFinding function within the OPRL algorithm, which is designed to generate open path rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-the_performance_of_fitness_functi.label: the performance of fitness functions
Entity-the_performance_of_fitness_functi.description: The performance of fitness functions refers to the effectiveness and quality assessment of various fitness functions used in the OPRL algorithm for learning Open Path rules in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-ophc__r_.label: OPHC(r)
Entity-ophc__r_.description: OPHC(r) refers to the open path head coverage metric, which is defined as the ratio of the open path support of an open path rule r to the number of entities that can satisfy the head part of the rule in a knowledge graph.

Entity-popular_benchmark_kg.label: popular benchmark KGs
Entity-popular_benchmark_kg.description: Popular benchmark KGs refer to widely used knowledge graphs, such as Freebase, YAGO2, and Wikidata, that serve as standard datasets for evaluating the performance of knowledge graph completion methods.

Entity-top_prediction.label: top prediction
Entity-top_prediction.description: The term 'top prediction' refers to the most relevant or highest-confidence query generated by the OPRL algorithm in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-sample.label: sample
Entity-sample.description: In this context, 'sample' refers to a subset of entities, specifically limited to a maximum of 800 entities, used for conducting experiments in the evaluation of the OPRL algorithm for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-recall.label: recall
Entity-recall.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'recall' refers to a performance metric that measures the proportion of relevant queries generated by the Open Path rules that successfully retrieve the correct answers from a complete knowledge graph.

Entity-p2.label: P2
Entity-p2.description: P2 refers to a specific predicate in the context of generating Open Path (OP) rules for knowledge graph completion, as illustrated in the rule generated by the PathFinding() method.

Entity-rule_with_the_property.label: rules with the properties
Entity-rule_with_the_property.description: The term 'rules with the properties' refers to specific characteristics or conditions that enhance the quality and effectiveness of Open Path (OP) rules in knowledge graph completion, particularly in relation to the co-occurrence of entities and predicates within the rule structure.

Entity-fact_in_the_kg.label: facts in the KG
Entity-fact_in_the_kg.description: Facts in the knowledge graph refer to the individual pieces of information or data points that are represented within a structured framework designed to store and manage knowledge in a way that enables efficient retrieval and reasoning.

Entity-mining.label: mining
Entity-mining.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'mining' refers to the process of extracting valuable rules or patterns from large datasets, specifically in this paper, the extraction of Open Path rules from massive knowledge graphs to enhance query generation.

Entity-some_missing_fact.label: some missing fact
Entity-some_missing_fact.description: The term 'some missing fact' refers to an entity or piece of information that is not present in the knowledge graph but can be inferred or retrieved through relevant questions generated by the proposed OPRL system, assuming the existence of a perfect link predictor.

Entity-query.label: queries
Entity-query.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'queries' refer to requests for information or data that are generated to address gaps in the knowledge graph, particularly when closed rules cannot provide answers.

Entity-target_rule.label: target rules
Entity-target_rule.description: The term 'target rules' refers to the specific rules generated for a designated predicate in the context of mining high-quality Open Path (OP) rules from a knowledge graph, which are used to enhance the completion of the graph by establishing connections between entities.

Entity-actively_generated_question.label: actively generated questions
Entity-actively_generated_question.description: Actively generated questions refer to the queries derived from open path rules in knowledge graph completion that aim to identify missing facts and facilitate the discovery of unknown entities by prompting relevant inquiries.

Entity-the_problem_of_knowledge_graph_co.label: the problem of knowledge graph completion
aliases: the problem of knowledge graph completion
Entity-the_problem_of_knowledge_graph_co.description: The problem of knowledge graph completion refers to the challenge of identifying and inferring missing information within knowledge graphs by generating relevant queries that can uncover these gaps.

mentions.local_name: the problem of knowledge graph completion

Entity-path.label: path
Entity-path.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, a 'path' refers to a closed path rule, which is a sequence of links forming a single unbroken loop that connects variables within the graph, allowing for the inference of new facts based on existing relationships.

Entity-the_experiment.label: the experiment
Entity-the_experiment.description: The experiment refers to the repeated evaluation of the OPRL algorithm's performance on the complete Poker Knowledge Graph to assess the absence of anomalies in query generation results.

Entity-a_preference_given_to_those_with_.label: a preference given to those with a higher probability in the KG
aliases: a preference given to those with a higher probability in the KG
Entity-a_preference_given_to_those_with_.description: The term 'a preference given to those with a higher probability in the KG' refers to the strategy of prioritizing the generation of queries in active knowledge graph completion based on the likelihood of their relevance or correctness, as determined by the confidence degree derived from mined OP rules.

mentions.local_name: a preference given to those with a higher probability in the KG

Entity-the_baseline.label: the baselines
Entity-the_baseline.description: The baselines refer to the standard methods or algorithms used as comparison points in the evaluation of the proposed OPRL method for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-this_set_of_query.label: this set of queries
Entity-this_set_of_query.description: This set of queries refers to the collection of potential queries generated from existing facts in a knowledge graph, specifically in the context of active knowledge graph completion (AKGC), where the queries are of the form P(?, e') and P(e, ?) for a given predicate P.

Entity-formal_quality_criterion.label: formal quality criteria
Entity-formal_quality_criterion.description: Formal quality criteria refer to the systematic standards and metrics used to evaluate the effectiveness and relevance of rules learned for knowledge graph completion, particularly in the context of the proposed OPRL algorithm.

Entity-the_output_of_the_two_system.label: the outputs of the two systems
aliases: the outputs of the two systems
Entity-the_output_of_the_two_system.description: The outputs of the two systems refer to the generated queries from the OPRL and RLvLR* algorithms, which are compared using ROC curves to evaluate their performance in query generation for knowledge graph completion.

mentions.local_name: the outputs of the two systems

Entity-answer.label: answers
Entity-answer.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'answers' refers to the predicted facts or entities that are inferred to fill gaps in the knowledge graph based on existing data and rules.

Entity-approach.label: approach
Entity-approach.description: The 'approach' refers to a novel method for addressing the issue of missing entities in knowledge graph completion by generating relevant queries through the learning of open path rules.

Entity-closed__non-existential__rule.label: closed (non-existential) rules
Entity-closed__non-existential__rule.description: Closed (non-existential) rules are a type of logic rule used in knowledge graph completion that answer queries derived from a holdback test set, allowing for the completion of knowledge graphs by providing answers to queries of unclear origin.

Entity-closed_rule.label: Closed rules
Entity-closed_rule.description: Closed rules are a type of logic rule used in knowledge graph completion that answer queries of unclear origin, typically derived from a holdback test set in experimental settings.

Entity-existential_rule_from_knowledge_g.label: existential rules from knowledge graphs
Entity-existential_rule_from_knowledge_g.description: Existential rules from knowledge graphs refer to a type of logical rule that allows for the expression of relationships and constraints in knowledge graphs, enabling the generation of new facts and queries based on incomplete data.

Entity-each_rule_on_generation.label: each rule on generation

Entity-ophc.label: OPHC
Entity-ophc.description: OPHC refers to a quality measure used to evaluate the performance of Open Path rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-method_proposed_in_rlvlr.label: method proposed in RLVLR
Entity-method_proposed_in_rlvlr.description: The method proposed in RLVLR refers to an approach that extends the RESCAL algorithm to compute argument embeddings derived from entity embeddings for improved scalability in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-open_path_standard_confidence__op.label: open path standard confidence (OPSC)
Entity-open_path_standard_confidence__op.description: Open Path Standard Confidence (OPSC) is a metric used to evaluate the quality of mined open path rules in knowledge graph completion, defined as the ratio of the number of entity pairs satisfying the head of the rule to the number satisfying the body of the rule.

Entity-incpathfinding.description: IncPathFinding is a method that generates additional candidate rules for knowledge graph completion by extending top-ranked rules identified in the PathFinding algorithm.

Entity-local_co-occurrence_fitness.label: local co-occurrence fitness
Entity-local_co-occurrence_fitness.description: Local co-occurrence fitness is a statistical measure used to evaluate the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion by assessing the similarity of entity embeddings along the paths defined by the rules.

Entity-o_e.label: o_e
Entity-o_e.description: In the context of knowledge graphs, 'o_e' represents the count of occurrences of an entity 'e' as the object argument in the predicate 'P', which is used to compute the argument embedding for the object position in the rule learning process.

Entity-quality_rule.label: quality rules
Entity-quality_rule.description: Quality rules refer to the mined rules from knowledge graphs that meet specific quality thresholds, indicated by their OPSC and OPHC scores, which assess their accuracy and relevance for generating queries in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-op_language.label: OP language
Entity-op_language.description: The OP language refers to a formal language used in the context of Open Path rules for generating queries in knowledge graph completion, which allows for the formulation of constrained existential rules.

aliases: embedding the entities and predicates of a given KG

Entity-the_optimum_obtained_by_tuning.label: the optimum obtained by tuning

Entity-opscophc_threshold.label: OPSC/OPHC thresholds
Entity-opscophc_threshold.description: OPSC/OPHC thresholds refer to the quality thresholds used in the OPRL algorithm to filter and assess the relevance of queries generated for knowledge graph completion, where OPSC indicates a minimum score for rule quality and OPHC represents a minimum threshold for the confidence of the generated queries.

Entity-pairwise_local_occurrence.description: Pairwise local occurrences refer to the individual co-occurrences of entities within the context of open path rules, which are aggregated to evaluate the overall co-occurrence fitness of a rule in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-the_body.label: the body
Entity-the_body.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'the body' refers to the part of a closed path rule that consists of predicates linking variables, which must be satisfied in order to infer a new fact represented by the rule's head.

Entity-the_head_(1).label: the head
Entity-the_head_(1).description: In the context of open path (OP) rules within knowledge graph completion, 'the head' refers to the predicate that connects the subject argument to the object argument in a rule, representing the primary relationship being established between entities.

Entity-the_object_argument_of_p_n.label: the object argument of P_n
Entity-the_object_argument_of_p_n.description: The object argument of P_n refers to the set of entities that serve as the second argument in the predicate P_n within a knowledge graph, whose embeddings are averaged to represent the overall connection in the context of open path rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-instance_fact.label: instance fact
Entity-instance_fact.description: An 'instance fact' refers to a specific piece of information or data point that is present in the test data of a knowledge graph, which is used to evaluate the relevance of queries generated by the OPRL algorithm.

Entity-head.label: head
Entity-head.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, the term 'head' refers to the initial part of a rule that represents the conclusion or inferred fact derived from the conditions specified in the rule's body.

Entity-scale.label: scale
Entity-scale.description: In the context of the paper, 'scale' refers to the ability of methods for automatic knowledge graph completion, particularly those involving rule learning, to efficiently handle large datasets and maintain performance.

Entity-p_1__z_0__z_1_.label: P_1(z_0, z_1)
Entity-p_1__z_0__z_1_.description: P_1(z_0, z_1) is a predicate in the context of open path rules for knowledge graph completion, representing a relationship between the bound variable z_0 and the variable z_1, which is part of a logical expression used to infer queries from the knowledge graph.

Entity-e_2.label: e_2
Entity-e_2.description: e_2 refers to an entity in a knowledge graph that is part of the body of an open path rule, which is used to assess the relationships between entities in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-the_power_of_kg.label: The power of KGs
Entity-the_power_of_kg.description: The power of KGs refers to their ability to model and store vast amounts of weakly-structured data through a flexible, data-first approach that allows for the addition of information with minimal structural constraints.

Entity-the_final_result_of_the_algorithm.label: the final result of the algorithm
aliases: the final result of the algorithm
Entity-the_final_result_of_the_algorithm.description: The final result of the algorithm refers to the set of candidate rules that have passed the evaluation criteria in the context of the proposed method for active knowledge graph completion.

mentions.local_name: the final result of the algorithm

Entity-p_1__e_1___.label: P_1(e_1, ?)
Entity-p_1__e_1___.description: P_1(e_1, ?) represents a query pattern used in active knowledge graph completion to identify missing entities related to the predicate P_1, where e_1 is a known entity and the '?' denotes an unknown entity that needs to be inferred.

Entity-it_embedding_representation.label: its embedding representation
Entity-it_embedding_representation.description: The term 'its embedding representation' refers to a mathematical representation of candidate rules in a knowledge graph, which is used to estimate their quality in the context of the proposed method for active knowledge graph completion.

Entity-missing_entity.label: missing entity
Entity-missing_entity.description: The 'missing entity' refers to an entity that is not currently present in a Knowledge Graph (KG) but is necessary for completing queries and enhancing the graph's completeness.

Entity-early_exploration.label: early explorations
Entity-early_exploration.description: Early explorations refer to the initial research and foundational work that laid the groundwork for the development of novel methods and algorithms in knowledge graph completion, particularly those involving open path rules and active query generation.

Entity-the_body_and_the_head_of_a_cp_rul.label: the body and the head of a CP rule
aliases: the body and the head of a CP rule
Entity-the_body_and_the_head_of_a_cp_rul.description: The body and the head of a CP rule refer to the two components of a closed path rule in knowledge graph completion, where the body consists of predicates that must be satisfied by a pair of entities, and the head represents the inferred relationship between those entities, forming a logical implication.

mentions.local_name: the body and the head of a CP rule

Entity-pair_connected_via_the_body.label: pairs connected via the body
Entity-pair_connected_via_the_body.description: The term 'pairs connected via the body' refers to the pairs of entities that are related through the predicates in the body of an Open Path (OP) rule in knowledge graph completion, where these pairs are distinct from the head of the rule and do not exhibit holistic similarity.

Entity-minimum_threshold_for_opsc_and_op.label: Minimum thresholds for OPSC and OPHC
aliases: Minimum thresholds for OPSC and OPHC
Entity-minimum_threshold_for_opsc_and_op.description: Minimum thresholds for OPSC and OPHC refer to the predefined criteria used in the evaluation process of candidate rules in the context of knowledge graph completion, specifically to filter out low-quality rules based on their computed scores for the Open Path Support Count (OPSC) and Open Path Head Count (OPHC) metrics.

mentions.local_name: Minimum thresholds for OPSC and OPHC

Entity-hybrid_approach.label: hybrid approach
Entity-hybrid_approach.description: The 'hybrid approach' refers to a methodology that combines two fitness functions, co-occurrence and open path, to effectively select the top candidate rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-a_good_rule_about_that_predicate.label: a good rule about that predicate
aliases: a good rule about that predicate
Entity-a_good_rule_about_that_predicate.description: A good rule about that predicate refers to a high-quality operational path rule that can be generated and extended during the mining process of a knowledge graph, specifically aimed at enhancing the completeness and accuracy of the graph by incorporating additional relevant predicates.

mentions.local_name: a good rule about that predicate

Entity-this_observation.label: this observation
Entity-this_observation.description: The term 'this observation' refers to the insight that the relationship between predicates in open path rules can be leveraged to define a co-occurrence fitness function for estimating rule quality in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-target_predicate.label: target predicate
Entity-target_predicate.description: The 'target predicate' refers to a specific relation or property within a knowledge graph that is the focus of mining high-quality Open Path (OP) rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-a_query.label: a query
Entity-a_query.description: A query refers to an open-ended question generated from open path rules in knowledge graph completion, aimed at identifying missing facts or entities by soliciting relevant information from users or external sources.

Entity-possible_query_about_this_set_of_.label: Possible queries about this set of facts
aliases: Possible queries about this set of facts
Entity-possible_query_about_this_set_of_.description: The term 'Possible queries about this set of facts' refers to the specific queries that can be generated from a given set of facts in a knowledge graph, which are structured in the form of predicates with one or more free variables, allowing for the exploration of potential relationships and missing links within the graph.

mentions.local_name: Possible queries about this set of facts

Entity-each_query.label: each query
Entity-each_query.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'each query' refers to the individual questions posed to link predictors, which are designed to retrieve a ranked list of entities that may answer the questions based on the available data in the knowledge graph.

Entity-user_parameter.label: user parameters
Entity-user_parameter.description: User parameters refer to the configurable settings that define the maximum length of rules and the minimum acceptable scores for OPSC and OPHC in the context of the OPRL algorithm for mining OP rules from a knowledge graph.

Entity-length.label: length
Entity-length.description: In this context, 'length' refers to the maximum number of components or elements in the rules generated by the OPRL algorithm, which influences both the complexity of the rules and the computational time required for mining them.

Entity-the_maximum_length_of_target_rule.label: the maximum length of target rules
aliases: the maximum length of target rules
Entity-the_maximum_length_of_target_rule.description: The maximum length of target rules refers to the upper limit on the number of predicates that can be included in the generated Open Path (OP) rules during the mining process of a knowledge graph, which is crucial for determining the complexity and expressiveness of the rules being learned.

mentions.local_name: the maximum length of target rules

Entity-novel__efficient_vector_computati.label: novel, efficient vector computation
Entity-novel__efficient_vector_computati.description: The 'novel, efficient vector computation' refers to a newly developed computational method introduced in the paper for formally evaluating the quality of rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-confidence.label: confidence
Entity-confidence.description: In the context of rule learning for knowledge graph completion, 'confidence' refers to the standard confidence (SC) metric, which quantifies how frequently a rule is true by measuring the proportion of inferred head instances that are satisfied given the ways the rule's body is satisfied in the knowledge graph.

Entity-a_hybrid_approach.label: a hybrid approach
Entity-a_hybrid_approach.description: A hybrid approach refers to a method that combines multiple fitness functions, specifically co-occurrence and open path fitness functions, to enhance the rule quality estimation in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-sequential_entity.label: sequential entities
Entity-sequential_entity.description: Sequential entities refer to the interconnected entities along a path in a knowledge graph, where their relationships are evaluated through argument embeddings to assess the quality of rules in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-endpoint.label: endpoints
Entity-endpoint.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'endpoints' refer to the entities that satisfy the subject and object arguments of a predicate in an open path rule, which are crucial for evaluating the quality of the rule by connecting a chain of predicates.

Entity-quality_of_each_candidate_rule_ba.label: quality of each candidate rule based on its embedding representation
aliases: quality of each candidate rule based on its embedding representation
Entity-quality_of_each_candidate_rule_ba.description: The entity refers to a method for evaluating the effectiveness of potential rules in knowledge graph completion by analyzing their representation in an embedding space.

mentions.local_name: quality of each candidate rule based on its embedding representation

Entity-_x__z_i__y_.label: {x, z_i, y}
Entity-_x__z_i__y_.description: The term {x, z_i, y} refers to a set of variables in the context of open path rules for knowledge graph completion, where x and y are free variables representing entities, and z_i are bound variables that connect predicates in the knowledge graph.

Entity-object_argument_of_p_i.label: object argument of P_i
Entity-object_argument_of_p_i.description: The 'object argument of P_i' refers to the second argument position in a predicate P_i within an Open Path (OP) rule, which is used to connect entities in a knowledge graph and is crucial for evaluating the co-occurrence relationships between predicates in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-p__1__t.label: P(1)^T
Entity-p__1__t.description: P(1)^T refers to the transposed embedding vector of the subject argument of a predicate P, used in the open path fitness function to estimate the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-fewer_rule.label: fewer rules
Entity-fewer_rule.description: The term 'fewer rules' refers to the reduced number of rules induced by the YAGO2 knowledge graph, which is attributed to its lack of repeatable patterns and potentially more missing facts, leading to weaker performance in knowledge graph completion tasks.

Entity-current_link_predictor.label: current link predictors
Entity-current_link_predictor.description: Current link predictors refer to models or algorithms used in knowledge graph completion that predict missing facts about existing entities based on the relationships and data present in the knowledge graph.

Entity-k___e__f_.label: K = (E, F)
Entity-k___e__f_.description: K = (E, F) represents a knowledge graph where E is the set of entities and F is the set of facts that relate those entities.

Entity-5___e_1__e_2__e_3__e_4__e_5__.label: 5 ({e_1, e_2, e_3, e_4, e_5})
Entity-5___e_1__e_2__e_3__e_4__e_5__.description: The mention '5 ({e_1, e_2, e_3, e_4, e_5})' refers to the count of five specific entities that can instantiate the variable z_0 in the head part of an open path rule for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-extended_rule.label: extended rules
Entity-extended_rule.description: The term 'extended rules' refers to the modified logical statements in the context of knowledge graph completion, where original rules are augmented by adding new predicates to their body to enhance their applicability and effectiveness in generating queries.

Entity-a_first_solution.label: a first solution
Entity-a_first_solution.description: The term 'a first solution' refers to the novel approach introduced in the paper for active knowledge graph completion (AKGC), which focuses on generating relevant queries to identify and complete missing facts in knowledge graphs rather than merely suggesting missing facts.

Entity-a_body_at_the_tail.label: a body at the tail
Entity-a_body_at_the_tail.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'a body at the tail' refers to the component of a closed path rule that contains predicates and variables, which collectively define the conditions under which the rule can infer a new fact in the knowledge graph.

Entity-they.label: they
Entity-they.description: The term 'they' refers to rules in the context of knowledge graph completion that are deemed more useful when they generalize well by explaining a larger number of facts.

Entity-answering_such_question.label: answering such questions
Entity-answering_such_question.description: The term 'answering such questions' refers to the process of providing responses to queries generated for knowledge graph completion, typically involving the identification of relevant entities or facts within a knowledge graph.

Entity-pathfinding__.label: PathFinding()
Entity-pathfinding__.description: PathFinding() is a method used to exhaustively generate Open Path (OP) rules for a specified target predicate and its inverse by computing embeddings and applying a shortest-first order approach.

Entity-minimum_sc.label: minimum SC
Entity-minimum_sc.description: The minimum SC refers to a parameter used in the OPRL algorithm for query generation, which sets a threshold for the quality of the rules mined from knowledge graphs.

Entity-previous_approach.label: previous approach
Entity-previous_approach.description: The 'previous approach' refers to earlier methods in rule learning from knowledge graphs that primarily focused on generating closed rules, which are less expressive and do not produce relevant queries for link predictors in the knowledge graph completion process.

Entity-5.description: The term '5' refers to the number of entities that can instantiate the variable z_0 to satisfy the head part of an open path rule in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-probabilistic-based_query_generat.label: probabilistic-based query generator
Entity-probabilistic-based_query_generat.description: The probabilistic-based query generator is a baseline method used to generate queries for knowledge graph completion, which operates on probabilistic models to create relevant questions that can uncover missing facts in a knowledge graph.

Entity-the_latter.label: the latter
Entity-the_latter.description: The latter refers to the fitness function that incorporates predicate embeddings in addition to entity embeddings for evaluating the quality of open path rules in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-a_link_predictor.label: a link predictor
Entity-a_link_predictor.description: A link predictor is a method or algorithm used in knowledge graph completion that generates a ranked list of potential entities to fill in missing relationships or facts within a knowledge graph.

Entity-major_approach_to_rule_learning.label: major approaches to rule learning
Entity-major_approach_to_rule_learning.description: Major approaches to rule learning refer to the various methodologies and techniques employed in the field of rule learning, particularly in the context of knowledge graph completion, which utilize metrics such as support, head coverage, and standard confidence to evaluate the effectiveness and generalization of learned rules.

Entity-pair_of_entity.label: pair of entities
Entity-pair_of_entity.description: The 'pair of entities' refers to two specific entities, denoted as e and e', that fulfill the conditions of the body of an open path (OP) rule in a knowledge graph, where a sequence of predicates connects them through other entities.

Entity-a_heuristic_for_mining_logical_ax.label: a heuristic for mining logical axioms
aliases: a heuristic for mining logical axioms
Entity-a_heuristic_for_mining_logical_ax.description: A heuristic for mining logical axioms refers to a systematic approach or method that utilizes the RESCAL embedding technique to effectively identify and extract logical rules or axioms from knowledge graphs, enhancing the process of knowledge graph completion.

mentions.local_name: a heuristic for mining logical axioms

Entity-head_coverage.label: head coverage
Entity-head_coverage.description: Head coverage is a statistical metric that measures the proportion of facts satisfying the head of a rule that can be inferred by satisfying the rule's body, reflecting the explanatory power of the rule in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-pm.label: Pm
Entity-pm.description: Pm refers to the set of all predicates in the knowledge graph, represented as a collection of matrices used in the evaluation of candidate rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-traditional_link_prediction.label: traditional link prediction
Entity-traditional_link_prediction.description: Traditional link prediction refers to the process of predicting missing relationships or facts in a knowledge graph by utilizing existing data and models, often through the application of closed rules that infer specific facts based on known entities.

Entity-a_head_at_the_front_of_the_implic.label: a head at the front of the implication arrow
aliases: a head at the front of the implication arrow
Entity-a_head_at_the_front_of_the_implic.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'a head at the front of the implication arrow' refers to the part of a closed path rule that represents the conclusion or target fact inferred from the conditions specified in the body of the rule.

mentions.local_name: a head at the front of the implication arrow

Entity-max_rule_length_l.label: max rule length l
Entity-max_rule_length_l.description: The 'max rule length l' refers to a parameter that specifies the maximum allowable length of the rules generated during the mining process of Open Path rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-an_entity.label: an entity
Entity-an_entity.description: An entity refers to a distinct object or concept that is represented within a Knowledge Graph (KG), which may be missing or not explicitly recorded in the KG, and is involved in the prediction of missing facts.

Entity-the_explanatory_power_of_the_rule.label: the explanatory power of the rule
aliases: the explanatory power of the rule
Entity-the_explanatory_power_of_the_rule.description: The explanatory power of the rule refers to the head coverage (HC) metric, which quantifies the proportion of facts that can be inferred from the body of a rule in a knowledge graph, indicating how well the rule generalizes and explains the relationships within the graph.

mentions.local_name: the explanatory power of the rule

Entity-matrix__p_k_.label: matrices {P_k}
Entity-matrix__p_k_.description: The matrices {P_k} represent the learned embeddings of predicates in the RESCAL model, where each matrix is associated with a predicate and captures the interactions between entities in a knowledge graph.

Entity-body.label: body
Entity-body.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, the term 'body' refers to the part of a rule that contains predicates and variables, which is used to infer new facts by satisfying the conditions defined within it.

Entity-anomaly.label: anomaly
Entity-anomaly.description: In this context, 'anomaly' refers to an unexpected deviation in the performance of the OPRL query generation system, specifically observed when the OPSC threshold is set to 0.9, indicating potential issues related to the incompleteness of the FB15KSE knowledge graph.

Entity-useful_(1).label: useful
Entity-useful_(1).description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'useful' refers to the quality of rules that effectively generalize and explain a significant number of facts within the knowledge graph.

Entity-additional_candidate_rule.label: additional candidate rules
Entity-additional_candidate_rule.description: Additional candidate rules refer to the newly generated rules in the IncPathFinding() process, which are created by extending existing top-ranked rules to enhance the knowledge graph completion capabilities.

Entity-evaluate__.label: Evaluate()
Entity-evaluate__.description: Evaluate() is a method used to assess the quality of candidate rules in the context of mining Open Path rules from a knowledge graph, utilizing metrics OPSC and OPHC for evaluation.

Entity-evaluation__.label: Evaluation()
Entity-evaluation__.description: Evaluation() refers to the evaluation method in Algorithm 1 that assesses the quality of candidate rules for knowledge graph completion based on specific metrics derived from the sampled knowledge graph.

Entity-efficient_matrix_and_vector_multi.label: efficient matrix and vector multiplication
Entity-efficient_matrix_and_vector_multi.description: Efficient matrix and vector multiplication refers to optimized computational techniques used to perform matrix and vector operations rapidly, which are essential for evaluating the quality of rules in knowledge graph completion algorithms, thereby enhancing scalability.

Entity-p_n__z___n-1___y_.label: P_n(z_{n-1}, y)
Entity-p_n__z___n-1___y_.description: P_n(z_{n-1}, y) is a predicate in an open path rule that represents a relationship between the variable z_{n-1} and the variable y, used in the context of knowledge graph completion to generate queries based on existing relationships.

Entity-a_long-standing_gap_in_traditiona.label: a long-standing gap in traditional link prediction systems
aliases: a long-standing gap in traditional link prediction systems
Entity-a_long-standing_gap_in_traditiona.description: The term 'a long-standing gap in traditional link prediction systems' refers to the inadequacy of existing link prediction methods to autonomously generate relevant queries for identifying missing facts in knowledge graphs, which is essential for effective knowledge graph completion.

mentions.local_name: a long-standing gap in traditional link prediction systems

Entity-the_quality.label: the quality
Entity-the_quality.description: The quality refers to the effectiveness of rule candidates in knowledge graph completion, which is estimated using fitness functions based on co-occurrence and open path embeddings.

Entity-these_parameter.label: These parameters
Entity-these_parameter.description: These parameters refer to the maximum rule length and the extension length used in the OPRL algorithm, which were determined to be optimal through a tuning process.

Entity-query_soliciting_missing_fact.label: queries soliciting missing facts
Entity-query_soliciting_missing_fact.description: Queries soliciting missing facts refer to inquiries generated by rules with free variables in knowledge graphs, aimed at identifying and retrieving information that is absent from the existing knowledge base.

Entity-rule_with_more_complex_shape.label: rules with more complex shapes
Entity-rule_with_more_complex_shape.description: Rules with more complex shapes refer to advanced rule structures in knowledge graph completion that extend beyond simple patterns, potentially incorporating configurations like star shapes and numerical attributes, aimed at enhancing the expressiveness and utility of the learned rules.

Entity-foundation.label: foundations
Entity-foundation.description: In this context, 'foundations' refers to the fundamental concepts and principles that underpin the development and understanding of the target language for learning Open Path rules in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-link.label: links
Entity-link.description: In the context of knowledge graphs, 'links' refer to the connections represented as RDF triples that establish relationships between entities, forming a closed path in rule-based systems.

Entity-z_1.label: z_1
Entity-z_1.description: z_1 is a logical variable used in the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, representing an unspecified entity within the body of a closed path rule.

Entity-p5.label: P5
Entity-p5.description: P5 refers to a predicate in the context of a logical expression used to extend a rule in the process of mining Open Path rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-the_rule.label: the rule
Entity-the_rule.description: The rule refers to a logical construct in knowledge graph completion that expresses a relationship between entities, consisting of a head and a body, where the body must be satisfied to infer the truth of the head within the context of the knowledge graph.

Entity-it_head.label: its head
Entity-it_head.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'its head' refers to the target part of a closed path rule that represents the conclusion or inferred fact derived from the rule's body.

Entity-one_correct_answer.label: one correct answer
Entity-one_correct_answer.description: The term 'one correct answer' refers to a specific type of query response in knowledge graph completion, where the expectation is to retrieve a single, definitive entity as the answer, contrasting with link predictors that provide a ranked list of potential answers.

Entity-three_baseline_query_set.label: three baseline query sets
Entity-three_baseline_query_set.description: The term 'three baseline query sets' refers to a set of query collections developed as a comparative benchmark for evaluating the relevance of queries generated by the OPRL algorithm, specifically designed to match the cardinality of queries produced by OPRL and generated using a random selection process based on predicates and entities from a test set.

Entity-p_h.label: P_h
Entity-p_h.description: P_h refers to the single predicate in the head of a closed path rule used in rule-based knowledge graph completion, which is part of a logical expression that connects entities through a series of predicates.

Entity-an_answer_to_the_question.label: an answer to the question
Entity-an_answer_to_the_question.description: An answer to the question refers to the response or information that can be provided to a query generated from open path rules in knowledge graph completion, which may include introducing new entities that are currently absent from the knowledge graph.

Entity-the_target_predicate.label: the target predicate
Entity-the_target_predicate.description: The target predicate refers to a specific predicate in a knowledge graph that is used as a fixed reference point for generating Open Path (OP) rules, which are sequences of predicates designed to enhance knowledge graph completion.

Entity-this_short_paper.label: this short paper
Entity-this_short_paper.description: This short paper refers to a concise research document that discusses future research directions for existential rule learning in the context of knowledge graph completion, without proposing a specific learning system.

Entity-instance.label: instance
Entity-instance.description: In this context, 'instance' refers to a specific fact in the knowledge graph (KG) that corresponds to the head of a rule, demonstrating the relationship between entities as defined by the rule.

Entity-two_baseline.label: two baselines
Entity-two_baseline.description: The term 'two baselines' refers to the two comparative methods established for evaluating the performance of the OPRL system, specifically a probabilistic-based query generator and a modified rule-based link predictor that generates questions.

Entity-quality.label: quality
Entity-quality.description: In the context of the paper, 'quality' refers to the effectiveness or suitability of generated rules in the knowledge graph completion process, which is assessed using fitness functions based on entity and predicate embeddings.

Entity-the_former.label: The former
Entity-the_former.description: The former refers to the co-occurrence fitness function, which estimates the quality of rules in knowledge graph completion by utilizing only entity embeddings.

Entity-x.label: x
Entity-x.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'x' refers to a free variable used in the general form of a closed path rule, which is a symbolic representation that can be instantiated to infer new facts from existing knowledge graph data.

Entity-the_measure.label: the measures
Entity-the_measure.description: The measures refer to the metrics OPSC and OPHC used to evaluate the quality of candidate rules in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-completeness.label: completeness
Entity-completeness.description: In the context of knowledge graphs, 'completeness' refers to the extent to which a knowledge graph accurately represents all relevant entities and relationships, contrasting with relational databases that enforce strict structural constraints to ensure data completeness.

Entity-e3.label: e3
Entity-e3.description: e3 refers to an entity in a knowledge graph that is related to another entity e1 through a predicate P_i, indicating its role in the context of mining open path rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-z_i.label: z_i
Entity-z_i.description: In the context of open path rules for knowledge graph completion, z_i refers to a bound variable that is used within the predicates of the rule, representing an entity that is constrained by the relationships defined in the knowledge graph.

Entity-hybrid_fitness_function.label: hybrid fitness function
Entity-hybrid_fitness_function.description: The hybrid fitness function is a novel optimization method designed to evaluate and enhance the quality of rules generated for knowledge graph completion, demonstrating superior performance compared to traditional fitness functions.

Entity-somewhere__t_.label: somewhere (t)
Entity-somewhere__t_.description: In the context of open path rules for knowledge graph completion, 'somewhere (t)' refers to a variable representing an unspecified location or entity that is inferred to be associated with another entity based on the rule structure.

Entity-the_answer_fact.label: the answer facts
Entity-the_answer_fact.description: The answer facts refer to the specific pieces of information or data that are missing from the training set, which the generated queries aim to uncover in the context of knowledge graph completion.

Entity-embedding-based_fitness_function.label: embedding-based fitness function
Entity-embedding-based_fitness_function.description: The embedding-based fitness function is a mathematical model designed to efficiently estimate the quality of rules in the context of active knowledge graph completion.

Entity-ann.label: Ann
Entity-ann.description: Ann is an example entity used in the context of learning open path rules for knowledge graph completion, specifically referenced in the query format citizenOf(Ann, ?).

Entity-high-performing_predictor.label: high-performing predictor
Entity-high-performing_predictor.description: The term 'high-performing predictor' refers to an algorithm or model used in knowledge graph completion that aims to accurately rediscover missing facts from a knowledge graph by generating relevant queries.

Entity-p3__z1__y_.label: P3(z1,y)
Entity-p3__z1__y_.description: P3(z1,y) is a predicate in the context of an Open Path rule that connects the variable z1 to the variable y, contributing to the evaluation of candidate rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-minimum_threshold.label: Minimum thresholds
Entity-minimum_threshold.description: Minimum thresholds refer to the specified lower limits for the metrics OPSC and OPHC that are used in the evaluation of candidate rules in the context of the algorithm for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-inference_module.label: inference module
Entity-inference_module.description: The inference module is a software component that generates relevant queries for active knowledge graph completion by deriving them from knowledge graph facts and OP rules.

Entity-opsc__0.8.label: OPSC > 0.8
Entity-opsc__0.8.description: OPSC > 0.8 refers to a threshold metric indicating that the quality of mined Open Path rules is considered high, with an average score above 0.8, which signifies their accuracy in contributing to knowledge graph completion.

Entity-y.label: y
Entity-y.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'y' represents a variable that denotes the entity associated with the citizenship of another entity 'x' who studies in an institution 'z', as defined by the open path rule.

Entity-embedding.label: embedding
Entity-embedding.description: In the context of representation learning for knowledge graphs, 'embedding' refers to the process of mapping entities and predicates into a low-dimensional latent space, allowing for the reconstruction of the knowledge graph and the prediction of new facts based on learned vector representations.

Entity-the_head.label: the head
Entity-the_head.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'the head' refers to the single predicate at the front of an implication arrow in a closed path rule, which represents the target fact that can be inferred if the conditions specified in the body of the rule are satisfied.

Entity-the_author.label: the authors

Entity-e__e1__...__en_.description: E= {e1,...,en} represents the set of all entities within the knowledge graph K, which is used in the context of evaluating candidate rules for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-the_top_prediction.label: the top prediction

Entity-missing_fact.label: missing facts
Entity-missing_fact.description: The term 'missing facts' refers to specific pieces of information that are not present in a knowledge graph but can be inferred or predicted through learned rules, highlighting gaps in the data representation of entities and their relationships.

Entity-intersection.label: intersection

Entity-the_training_set.label: the training set
Entity-the_training_set.description: The training set refers to the subset of data used to train the OPRL algorithm, from which queries can be generated and which is distinct from the test set used to evaluate the relevance of those queries.

Entity-average_precision__recall__and_f1.label: average precision, recall, and F1
Entity-average_precision__recall__and_f1.description: Average precision, recall, and F1 are evaluation metrics used to assess the performance of query generation in knowledge graph completion, where average precision measures the accuracy of relevant queries, recall indicates the proportion of relevant queries that were successfully generated, and F1 provides a harmonic mean of precision and recall to balance their trade-offs.

Entity-the_quality_of_each_candidate_rul.label: the quality of each candidate rule

Entity-the_quality_of_each_candidate_rul.description: The quality of each candidate rule refers to a measure of how effectively a proposed rule, derived from knowledge graphs, can contribute to the completion of missing information, assessed through its embedding representation.

Entity-p4.label: P4

Entity-redundant.label: redundant
Entity-redundant.description: In the context of knowledge graph completion, 'redundant' refers to a rule that, when it achieves both 100% head coverage and standard confidence, explains every fact in the knowledge graph that is an instance of its head, indicating that the rule does not provide new information beyond what is already represented in the graph.

Entity-support_degree.label: support degree
Entity-support_degree.description: The support degree is a statistical measure that quantifies the number of entity pairs satisfying the body and head of an open path rule in a knowledge graph, indicating the rule's effectiveness in generating valid queries.

Entity-rescal_evaluation_function.label: RESCAL evaluation function
Entity-rescal_evaluation_function.description: The RESCAL evaluation function is a mathematical function used to compute the quality of a single predicate in knowledge graph completion by leveraging entity and predicate embeddings.

Entity-sequence_of_ranked_entity.label: sequence of ranked entities
Entity-sequence_of_ranked_entity.description: The 'sequence of ranked entities' refers to the ordered list of potential answers provided by link predictors in response to queries related to knowledge graph completion, where entities are ranked based on their relevance or likelihood of being the correct answer.

Entity-p_1__e__e_1___p_2__e_1__e_2___....label: P_1(e, e_1), P_2(e_1, e_2), ..., P_n(e_{n-1}, e')
Entity-p_1__e__e_1___p_2__e_1__e_2___....description: The term 'P_1(e, e_1), P_2(e_1, e_2), ..., P_n(e_{n-1}, e')' refers to a sequence of predicates that collectively form the body of a closed path rule in a knowledge graph, indicating that a pair of entities (e, e') is related through a chain of intermediary entities (e_1, ..., e_{n-1}) connected by these predicates.

Entity-quality_opsc__0.1.label: quality OPSC > 0.1
Entity-quality_opsc__0.1.description: The term 'quality OPSC > 0.1' refers to a threshold criterion for the quality of Open Path Semantic Completion (OPSC) scores, indicating that only rules with an OPSC score greater than 0.1 are considered high quality for inclusion in the evaluation of the OPRL algorithm's performance in knowledge graph completion.

Entity-z___n-1_.label: z_{n-1}
Entity-z___n-1_.description: In the context of rule-based knowledge graph completion, 'z_{n-1}' represents a variable in a closed path rule that is used to express relationships between entities within the knowledge graph.

Entity-evaluate.label: Evaluate
Entity-evaluate.description: Evaluate refers to the process of assessing the quality of candidate OP rules against a knowledge graph using specific quality measures, OPSC and OPHC, in the context of the proposed algorithm for mining OP rules.

Entity-p___i1_.description: P_{i+1} refers to a mathematical variable representing the subject argument of a predicate in an open path rule used for knowledge graph completion.

Entity-it_embedding_matrix.label: its embedding matrix
