This implies that the object is capable of adapting to the demands or requirements posed by the subject, thereby ensuring that both can function optimally together even as the scale of the subject changes.

Predicate-estimates.label: estimates
Predicate-estimates.description: The predicate 'estimates' indicates a relationship where the subject provides a calculated or inferred value regarding the characteristics, performance, or quality of the object. It suggests that the subject uses certain methods or criteria to assess or predict the state or level of the object in question.

Predicate-assess.label: assess
Predicate-assess.description: The predicate 'assess' indicates an evaluative action where the subject examines, judges, or determines the quality, value, or significance of the object. In this context, it connects the subject, which is the entity performing the evaluation, with the object, which is the aspect or characteristic being evaluated.

Predicate-assesses.label: assesses
Predicate-assesses.description: The predicate 'assesses' indicates an evaluative relationship where the subject performs an analysis or judgment on the object, determining its quality, effectiveness, or value. In this context, the subject is engaged in a process of examination or appraisal regarding the characteristics or performance of the object.

Predicate-evaluates_using.label: evaluates using
Predicate-evaluates_using.description: The predicate 'evaluates using' establishes a relationship where the subject employs a specific method, framework, or resource (the object) to assess, analyze, or determine the value, quality, or significance of something. This indicates that the subject relies on the object as a tool or reference point in the evaluation process.

Predicate-mines.label: mines
Predicate-mines.description: The predicate 'mines' indicates an action where the subject actively extracts or gathers valuable information, resources, or insights from a source, resulting in the acquisition of the object, which represents the specific items or knowledge obtained through this process.

Predicate-contains.label: contains
Predicate-contains.description: The predicate 'contains' indicates that the subject has within it or includes the object as a part or component. It establishes a relationship where the subject is a larger entity or collection that encompasses the object, which represents a specific element, quantity, or type of information that is found within the subject.

Predicate-contain.label: contain
Predicate-contain.description: The predicate 'contain' indicates that the subject has within it or includes the object as a part or component. It signifies a relationship where the subject encompasses or holds the object, suggesting that the object is an integral element of the subject's overall structure or composition.

Predicate-have_precision_as_high_as.label: have precision as high as
Predicate-have_precision_as_high_as.description: The predicate 'have precision as high as' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject possesses a level of accuracy or correctness that meets or exceeds the specified percentage represented by the object. This implies a quantitative measure of performance or reliability, suggesting that the subject's effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes is at least equal to the stated precision level.

Predicate-have_recall_of.label: have recall of
Predicate-have_recall_of.description: The predicate 'have recall of' indicates the extent to which the subject possesses the ability to remember or retrieve specific information, represented by the object. In this context, the subject is associated with a measurable percentage that reflects its memory performance or recall accuracy regarding the information in question.

Predicate-are_generated_from.label: are generated from
Predicate-are_generated_from.description: The predicate 'are generated from' indicates a relationship where the subject is produced or derived as a result of the processes, components, or elements represented by the object. It implies a transformation or creation process where the subject emerges as a consequence of the characteristics or information contained in the object.

Predicate-are_a_convenient_technology_to.label: are a convenient technology to model and store
Predicate-are_a_convenient_technology_to.description: The predicate 'are a convenient technology to model and store' indicates that the subject possesses qualities or features that make it an effective and user-friendly solution for organizing and preserving the object, which typically refers to a type of data or information. This suggests that the subject is capable of handling the complexities associated with the object, thereby facilitating easier access, retrieval, and management of the data.

Predicate-arises_from.label: arises from
Predicate-arises_from.description: The predicate 'arises from' indicates a causal or foundational relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject is a result or consequence of the characteristics, principles, or conditions represented by the object. It implies that the existence, quality, or effectiveness of the subject is directly linked to the object, which serves as the source or origin of that aspect.

Predicate-abound_in.label: abound in
Predicate-abound_in.description: The predicate 'abound in' indicates a plentiful presence or a significant quantity of the object within the subject. It suggests that the subject is characterized by or is rich in the qualities, elements, or features represented by the object, highlighting a strong association or abundance between the two.

Predicate-are_few_compared_to.label: are few compared to
Predicate-are_few_compared_to.description: The predicate 'are few compared to' establishes a comparative relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the quantity or occurrence of the subject is significantly lower when measured against the quantity or occurrence of the object. This suggests a relative scarcity or limited presence of the subject in contrast to the object.

Predicate-is_poorly_defined.label: is poorly defined
Predicate-is_poorly_defined.description: The predicate 'is poorly defined' indicates that the subject lacks clarity, precision, or a clear boundary in its meaning or application, particularly in relation to the object. This suggests that there is ambiguity or vagueness in how the subject is understood or interpreted in the context of the object.

Predicate-fail_to_record.label: fail to record
Predicate-fail_to_record.description: The predicate 'fail to record' indicates a lack of successful documentation or capture of information, where the subject is unable to properly register or note the details of the object. In this context, it suggests that the subject (e.g., KGs) did not achieve the intended action of recording the relevant entities, resulting in an absence of the expected data or information.

Predicate-are_more_richly_covered_than.label: are more richly covered than
Predicate-are_more_richly_covered_than.description: The predicate 'are more richly covered than' establishes a comparative relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject possesses a greater depth, detail, or abundance of information, content, or treatment in a particular context compared to the object. This suggests a qualitative assessment where the subject is seen as more comprehensive or elaborate in its coverage than the object.

Predicate-have_better_coverage_for.label: have better coverage for
Predicate-have_better_coverage_for.description: The predicate 'have better coverage for' indicates a relationship where the subject possesses a more extensive or comprehensive representation, understanding, or involvement regarding the object. It suggests that the subject is more effectively associated with or informed about the object compared to other subjects, highlighting a qualitative advantage in the context of the relationship.

Predicate-are_produced_in.label: are produced in
Predicate-are_produced_in.description: The predicate 'are produced in' indicates a relationship where the subject refers to entities that are created or generated within the geographical or contextual boundaries defined by the object. It establishes a connection between the subject, which represents the items or entities being produced, and the object, which specifies the locations or contexts where this production occurs.

Predicate-built_from.label: built from
Predicate-built_from.description: The predicate 'built from' indicates a foundational relationship where the subject is constructed or developed using the elements or materials represented by the object. It signifies that the subject's existence or structure is derived from, or relies on, the components specified in the object, highlighting a process of transformation or assembly.

Predicate-include.label: include
Predicate-include.description: The predicate 'include' establishes a relationship where the subject encompasses or contains the object as part of a larger whole. It indicates that the object is one of the elements or components that are part of the subject, suggesting a subset or a specific instance within a broader category.

Predicate-include_(1).label: include
Predicate-include_(1).description: The predicate 'include' denotes a relationship where the subject encompasses or contains the object as part of a larger whole. It indicates that the object is one of the elements or components that are part of the subject, suggesting a sense of belonging or incorporation within the broader context represented by the subject.

Predicate-are_prone_to_asserting.label: are prone to asserting
Predicate-are_prone_to_asserting.description: The predicate 'are prone to asserting' indicates a tendency or inclination of the subject to make claims or statements that are often characterized by a lack of accuracy or truthfulness, as represented by the object. It suggests that the subject frequently engages in the act of asserting, which may lead to the propagation of misconceptions or inaccuracies.

Predicate-are_prone_to_missing.label: are prone to missing
Predicate-are_prone_to_missing.description: The predicate 'are prone to missing' indicates a tendency or likelihood of the subject to overlook, fail to include, or not account for the object. It suggests that there is a recurring pattern or vulnerability associated with the subject that results in the absence or neglect of the object in certain contexts.

Predicate-allow.label: allow
Predicate-allow.description: The predicate 'allow' indicates a permissive relationship where the subject grants permission or enables the object to occur, be accessed, or be utilized. It signifies that the subject provides the necessary conditions or authority for the object to be present or to take place.

Predicate-curates.label: curates
Predicate-curates.description: The predicate 'curates' indicates an action where the subject actively organizes, selects, and manages the object, ensuring that it is presented in a coherent and meaningful way. This involves the careful consideration of the components of the object, which in this context refers to KGs (knowledge graphs), to enhance their relevance, quality, and accessibility for users or systems.

Predicate-developed_for.label: developed for
Predicate-developed_for.description: The predicate 'developed for' indicates that the subject has been specifically created, designed, or tailored to serve a particular purpose or function related to the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is intended to address the needs, requirements, or characteristics of the object.

Predicate-are_learnt_from.label: are learnt from
Predicate-are_learnt_from.description: The predicate 'are learnt from' indicates a relationship where the subject acquires knowledge, skills, or information through the process or source identified by the object. It signifies that the subject's development or understanding is derived from the object, which serves as the foundation or reference point for the learning process.

Predicate-are_expressed_as.label: are expressed as
Predicate-are_expressed_as.description: The predicate 'are expressed as' indicates a relationship where the subject is represented, articulated, or defined in terms of the object. It suggests that the subject can be understood or interpreted through the lens of the object, highlighting a form of equivalence or transformation between the two entities.

Predicate-are_used_for.label: are used for
Predicate-are_used_for.description: The predicate 'are used for' indicates a functional relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject serves a specific purpose or role in relation to the object. It implies that the subject is employed or utilized in a manner that facilitates, supports, or accomplishes the action or goal represented by the object.

Predicate-predicts.label: predicts
Predicate-predicts.description: The predicate 'predicts' establishes a relationship where the subject provides an estimation or forecast regarding the occurrence or existence of the object. In this context, the subject is an entity or process that generates insights or conclusions, while the object represents the anticipated outcome or information that is not currently known or is uncertain.

Predicate-predicts_about.label: predicts about
Predicate-predicts_about.description: The predicate 'predicts about' establishes a relationship where the subject is an entity or concept that generates forecasts or estimations regarding the characteristics, behaviors, or occurrences related to the object. In this context, the subject provides insights or anticipations that pertain to the object, which represents the entities or phenomena being analyzed or considered.

Predicate-used_for.label: used for
Predicate-used_for.description: The predicate 'used for' indicates a functional relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject serves a specific purpose or role in relation to the object. It implies that the subject is employed or utilized in a manner that facilitates, supports, or accomplishes the action or goal represented by the object.

Predicate-learnt_from.label: learnt from
Predicate-learnt_from.description: The predicate 'learnt from' indicates a relationship where the subject has acquired knowledge, skills, or insights through the influence or information provided by the object. It signifies a process of learning or gaining understanding that originates from the object, suggesting that the subject has benefited from the experiences, data, or principles associated with the object.

Predicate-consider.label: consider
Predicate-consider.description: The predicate 'consider' indicates that the subject is taking into account, reflecting upon, or evaluating the object. It suggests a cognitive process where the subject is assessing the relevance, implications, or characteristics of the object in relation to its own context or objectives.

Predicate-are_used_to_predict.label: are used to predict
Predicate-are_used_to_predict.description: The predicate 'are used to predict' establishes a functional relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject serves as a tool, method, or framework that enables the forecasting or estimation of the object. In this context, the subject is typically a set of criteria, rules, or models that, when applied, allow for the anticipation of specific outcomes or facts represented by the object.

Predicate-defines_a_relationship_between.label: defines a relationship between
Predicate-defines_a_relationship_between.description: The predicate 'defines a relationship between' indicates that the subject establishes a connection or association with the object, illustrating how the two concepts interact or relate to one another within a specific context or framework.

Predicate-livesIn.label: livesIn
Predicate-livesIn.description: The predicate 'livesIn' establishes a relationship between an individual and a location, indicating that the individual resides or has their home in the specified location. In the context of the provided triple, it connects the subject, which denotes a person's citizenship or affiliation with a place, to an object that represents the specific place where the individual lives.

Predicate-locatedIn.label: locatedIn
Predicate-locatedIn.description: The predicate 'locatedIn' establishes a spatial relationship between two entities, indicating that one entity (the subject) is situated within the geographical or spatial boundaries defined by another entity (the object). In the context of the example triple, it connects the living situation of an individual to a specific location, suggesting that the location of the first entity is dependent on or related to the second entity's location.

Predicate-inferred_from.label: inferred from
Predicate-inferred_from.description: The predicate 'inferred from' indicates a relationship where the subject can be deduced or concluded based on the information or characteristics provided by the object. It suggests that the object serves as a basis or evidence that leads to the understanding or assumption of the subject.

Predicate-located_in.label: located in
Predicate-located_in.description: The predicate 'located in' establishes a spatial relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject exists within the geographical boundaries or jurisdiction defined by the object. It connects entities by specifying the place or area where the subject is found, thereby providing context about its position relative to a larger or encompassing entity.

Predicate-occur_in.label: occur in
Predicate-occur_in.description: The predicate 'occur in' establishes a relationship where the subject is found within or is a component of the object. It indicates that the subject is present in the context or framework defined by the object, suggesting a connection or relevance between the two elements.

Predicate-appear_at_least_twice.label: appear at least twice
Predicate-appear_at_least_twice.description: The predicate 'appear at least twice' indicates that the subject has a presence or occurrence that is not singular, but rather is repeated or manifested multiple times in relation to the object. This suggests a level of significance or relevance of the subject within the context of the object, implying that the subject's multiple appearances contribute to the understanding or characteristics of the object.

Predicate-enable.label: enable
Predicate-enable.description: The predicate 'enable' signifies a relationship where the subject provides the necessary conditions, tools, or capabilities that allow for the occurrence or realization of the action or state described by the object. In this context, the subject facilitates or empowers the object to be achieved or executed.

Predicate-is_missing_from.label: is missing from
Predicate-is_missing_from.description: The predicate 'is missing from' indicates a relationship where the subject is not present or lacks inclusion within the context or scope defined by the object. It suggests a deficiency or absence of the subject in the entity represented by the object, highlighting a gap or void that exists in the connection between the two.

Predicate-is_able_to_be_inferred_by.label: is able to be inferred by
Predicate-is_able_to_be_inferred_by.description: The predicate 'is able to be inferred by' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a piece of information or fact that can be deduced or concluded based on the knowledge or principles represented by the object. It indicates that the object provides the necessary reasoning or framework through which the subject can be logically understood or derived.

Predicate-considers.label: considers
Predicate-considers.description: The predicate 'considers' indicates that the subject engages in thoughtful reflection or evaluation regarding the object. It implies that the subject is examining, analyzing, or taking into account the object in a meaningful way, often leading to insights, conclusions, or implications related to the object.

Predicate-involves.label: involves
Predicate-involves.description: The predicate 'involves' indicates a relationship where the subject is engaged in or encompasses the object, suggesting that the subject contains, requires, or is associated with the object in a significant way.

Predicate-is_absent_from.label: is absent from
Predicate-is_absent_from.description: The predicate 'is absent from' indicates a relationship where the subject does not exist or is not found within the context or scope of the object. In this case, it signifies that the entities do not have a presence or representation in the knowledge graphs (KGs), highlighting a lack of association or inclusion between the two.

Predicate-exist_in.label: exist in
Predicate-exist_in.description: The predicate 'exist in' establishes a relationship where the subject is located within or is a part of the object. It indicates that the subject is contained, represented, or found within the context or framework of the object, suggesting a dependency or association between the two entities.

Predicate-is_related_to.label: is related to
Predicate-is_related_to.description: The predicate 'is related to' establishes a connection or association between the subject and the object, indicating that there is a relevant link or correlation between the two entities. This relationship can encompass various forms of connection, such as causal, contextual, or conceptual ties, suggesting that understanding one may provide insights into the other.

Predicate-may_be_absent_from.label: may be absent from
Predicate-may_be_absent_from.description: The predicate 'may be absent from' indicates a potential lack of presence or representation of the subject within the context of the object. It suggests that while the subject (such as entities) is expected to be included or found in the object (like a knowledge graph), there is a possibility that it is not currently represented or included. This highlights the uncertainty or variability in the relationship between the subject and the object, emphasizing that the subject's inclusion is not guaranteed.

Predicate-infer.label: infer
Predicate-infer.description: The predicate 'infer' denotes the process of deriving a conclusion or understanding from available information or premises. In the context of a subject and an object, it indicates that the subject utilizes reasoning or evidence to reach a conclusion about the object, suggesting a relationship where the subject interprets or deduces insights related to the object.

Predicate-are_examples_of.label: are examples of
Predicate-are_examples_of.description: The predicate 'are examples of' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a category or type, and the object is a specific instance or representation that falls within that category. It indicates that the object exemplifies or illustrates the characteristics or properties associated with the subject.

Predicate-done_by_answering.label: done by answering
Predicate-done_by_answering.description: The predicate 'done by answering' indicates a process or action where the subject engages in a task or activity that is fulfilled through the act of providing responses to inquiries or prompts represented by the object. This connection highlights the interactive nature of the subject's operation, emphasizing that the completion or achievement of the subject's goal is contingent upon the responses generated in relation to the questions posed.

Predicate-is_a_fragment_of.label: is a fragment of
Predicate-is_a_fragment_of.description: The predicate 'is a fragment of' indicates that the subject is a part or component of the object, suggesting that the subject contributes to or is included within the broader context or structure represented by the object. This relationship implies a hierarchical or compositional connection, where the subject cannot be fully understood without considering its role within the object.

Predicate-is_expressive_enough_to_adduce.label: is expressive enough to adduce
Predicate-is_expressive_enough_to_adduce.description: The predicate 'is expressive enough to adduce' indicates that the subject possesses a sufficient level of expressiveness or capability to effectively represent, generate, or derive the object. In this context, it suggests that the subject can adequately support or provide the necessary information, features, or functionalities to produce or explain the object, thereby establishing a functional relationship where the subject's expressiveness meets the requirements of the object.

Predicate-is_suitable_for.label: is suitable for
Predicate-is_suitable_for.description: The predicate 'is suitable for' establishes a relationship between a subject and an object, indicating that the subject possesses qualities, characteristics, or features that make it appropriate or effective for the purposes or requirements of the object. This connection implies that the subject can adequately fulfill the needs or functions associated with the object in a relevant context.

Predicate-provide_evidence_that.label: provide evidence that
Predicate-provide_evidence_that.description: The predicate 'provide evidence that' establishes a relationship where the subject is responsible for supplying or presenting information, data, or arguments that support the truth or validity of the object, which is typically a claim, assertion, or fact. This connection implies that the subject's role is to substantiate or reinforce the object through credible proof or reasoning.

Predicate-is_generated_accordingly.label: is generated accordingly
Predicate-is_generated_accordingly.description: The predicate 'is generated accordingly' indicates that the subject is produced or created in a manner that is consistent with or responsive to the characteristics, requirements, or context of the object. It implies a relationship where the generation process of the subject is aligned with the nature or type of the object, suggesting a systematic or rule-based approach to creation.

Predicate-identify.label: identify
Predicate-identify.description: The predicate 'identify' establishes a relationship where the subject recognizes, determines, or establishes the existence or nature of the object. It implies that the subject has the capability or authority to discern or point out the object, which is often a specific entity, concept, or fact that is being brought to attention or clarified.

Predicate-identify_that.label: identify that
Predicate-identify_that.description: The predicate 'identify that' serves to establish a connection between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject recognizes or determines the existence or truth of the object. It implies a cognitive process where the subject discerns or acknowledges a specific fact, concept, or piece of information represented by the object.

Predicate-is_needed_when.label: is needed when
Predicate-is_needed_when.description: The predicate 'is needed when' establishes a conditional relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject becomes necessary or required in the context of the situation or condition represented by the object. It implies that the presence or existence of the subject is essential for addressing, resolving, or understanding the circumstances described by the object.

Predicate-might_be.label: might be
Predicate-might_be.description: The predicate 'might be' indicates a possibility or uncertainty regarding the relationship between the subject and the object. It suggests that the subject has the potential to be identified or classified as the object, but this is not guaranteed. The use of 'might be' conveys that while there is a plausible connection, it remains speculative and open to interpretation.

Predicate-posed_to.label: posed to
Predicate-posed_to.description: The predicate 'posed to' indicates a relationship where the subject is directed towards or intended for the object, often implying that the subject is being presented, asked, or directed in a way that involves the object as the recipient or target of that action.

Predicate-introduces.label: introduces
Predicate-introduces.description: The predicate 'introduces' signifies the action of presenting or bringing forth something new or previously unrecognized, establishing a connection between the subject and the object. In this context, the subject is the entity that performs the act of introduction, while the object represents the new entities or concepts that are being presented or made known.

Predicate-complements.label: complements
Predicate-complements.description: The predicate 'complements' indicates a relationship where the subject enhances, completes, or adds to the understanding or functionality of the object. It suggests that the subject provides additional value or context that is beneficial when considered alongside the object, thereby creating a more comprehensive or effective overall concept.

Predicate-provides.label: provides
Predicate-provides.description: The predicate 'provides' indicates a relationship in which the subject offers, supplies, or makes available the object. It signifies that the subject is the source or provider of the object, which is typically something beneficial, useful, or necessary for the recipient or context implied by the subject.

Predicate-to.label: to
Predicate-to.description: The predicate 'to' indicates a directional or relational connection between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject is directed towards, associated with, or intended for the object. It often implies a purpose, goal, or function that the subject serves in relation to the object.

Predicate-complement.label: complement
Predicate-complement.description: The predicate 'complement' indicates that the subject provides additional information or enhances the understanding of the object, suggesting that the object is a necessary or beneficial addition to the subject in a particular context.

Predicate-is_not_an_alternative_to.label: is not an alternative to
Predicate-is_not_an_alternative_to.description: The predicate 'is not an alternative to' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject does not serve as a substitute or option for the object. It implies that while both the subject and object may relate to a similar domain or context, they are distinct approaches or methods that cannot replace one another in function or purpose.

Predicate-generate_(1).label: generate
Predicate-generate_(1).description: The predicate 'generate' indicates the action of producing or creating something from a given source or set of rules. In the context of the subject and object, it signifies that the subject has the capability or function to create the object, which can be an idea, item, or concept, based on its inherent properties or guidelines.

Predicate-could_introduce.label: could introduce
Predicate-could_introduce.description: The predicate 'could introduce' indicates a potential action or capability of the subject to bring forth, present, or make known the object. It suggests that the subject has the ability to initiate a process or event that results in the emergence or recognition of the object, which often involves new information, concepts, or entities.

Predicate-implies.label: implies
Predicate-implies.description: The predicate 'implies' establishes a logical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the truth or existence of the subject necessitates or leads to the truth or existence of the object. In this context, it suggests that if the conditions or statements represented by the subject are met, then the conditions or statements represented by the object must also hold true.

Predicate-studies_in.label: studies in
Predicate-studies_in.description: The predicate 'studies in' establishes a relationship between a subject, typically an individual or entity, and an object, which is an educational or research institution. It indicates that the subject is engaged in academic or research activities within the context of the specified institute, suggesting a focus on learning, research, or professional development in a particular field or discipline.

Predicate-is_a_citizen_of.label: is a citizen of
Predicate-is_a_citizen_of.description: The predicate 'is a citizen of' establishes a legal and social relationship between the subject (entity x) and the object (somewhere y), indicating that the subject is recognized as a member of the political community of the specified location. This relationship typically confers certain rights and responsibilities upon the subject, such as the right to vote, work, and reside in that location, as well as obligations like obeying its laws.

Predicate-studiesIn.label: studiesIn
Predicate-studiesIn.description: The predicate 'studiesIn' establishes a relationship between an entity, typically a student or researcher, and an institute, such as a university or research facility, indicating that the entity is engaged in academic or research activities within the context of that institute.

Predicate-instantiated_like.label: instantiated like
Predicate-instantiated_like.description: The predicate 'instantiated like' indicates that the subject and object represent the same conceptual or factual instance, suggesting that the subject is an example or manifestation of the type or category defined by the object. It establishes a relationship of equivalence or similarity between the two, implying that they can be understood as interchangeable in the context of the information being conveyed.

Predicate-infers.label: infers
Predicate-infers.description: The predicate 'infers' indicates a logical relationship where the subject provides evidence or reasoning that leads to a conclusion represented by the object. In this context, the subject's information or state implies or suggests the truth of the object, which is often a query or assertion that can be derived from the subject's attributes or actions.

Predicate-instantiates.label: instantiates
Predicate-instantiates.description: The predicate 'instantiates' denotes a relationship where the subject represents a specific instance or example of the concept expressed in the object. In the context of the provided triple, it indicates that the action or state described by the subject (e.g., studying at a particular institution) serves as a concrete realization or embodiment of the broader category or condition described by the object (e.g., being a citizen of a certain place). This predicate effectively links an individual or specific case to a more general classification or identity.

Predicate-addresses.label: addresses
Predicate-addresses.description: The predicate 'addresses' indicates that the subject is engaging with, responding to, or providing solutions for the issue, concern, or topic represented by the object. It implies a direct connection where the subject takes action or presents information that is relevant to the object, often with the intention of resolving or highlighting the significance of the object.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: The predicate 'use' indicates that the subject actively employs or utilizes the object in some capacity. It signifies a functional relationship where the subject relies on the object to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. This relationship can encompass various contexts, such as tools, resources, methods, or information, highlighting the practical application of the object by the subject.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: The predicate 'propose' indicates that the subject puts forward a suggestion, idea, or plan regarding the object. It implies an act of recommending or advocating for the object as a potential solution, course of action, or consideration in a given context.

Predicate-need_to_be_seeded_with.label: need to be seeded with
Predicate-need_to_be_seeded_with.description: The predicate 'need to be seeded with' indicates a requirement for the subject to be provided with specific inputs or foundational elements, represented by the object, in order to function effectively or achieve a desired outcome. This implies that the subject relies on the object as a necessary starting point or resource for its operation or development.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: The predicate 'evaluate' signifies the action of assessing, analyzing, or determining the quality, value, or effectiveness of the object in relation to the subject. It implies a process where the subject applies criteria or methods to form a judgment or conclusion about the object.

Predicate-generated_from.label: generated from
Predicate-generated_from.description: The predicate 'generated from' indicates a relationship where the subject is produced or derived as a result of the object. It signifies that the subject is a result of a process or transformation that utilizes the object as a foundational or source element.

Predicate-held_out_from.label: held out from
Predicate-held_out_from.description: The predicate 'held out from' indicates a relationship where the subject is excluded or separated from the object, suggesting that the subject does not include or is not part of the object in question. This can imply a deliberate choice to keep the subject distinct from the object, often for purposes such as testing, evaluation, or analysis.

Predicate-need.label: need
Predicate-need.description: The predicate 'need' expresses a relationship where the subject requires or depends on the object for a specific purpose or outcome. It indicates that the subject cannot achieve its goals or fulfill its functions without the presence or availability of the object.

Predicate-can_be_used_to_generate.label: can be used to generate
Predicate-can_be_used_to_generate.description: The predicate 'can be used to generate' indicates a functional relationship where the subject possesses the capability or utility to produce or create the object. It implies that the subject serves as a source or method that facilitates the formation of the object, suggesting a process of transformation or derivation from one state to another.

Predicate-will_rediscover.label: will rediscover
Predicate-will_rediscover.description: The predicate 'will rediscover' indicates a future action where the subject is expected to find or recognize something that was previously known but not currently acknowledged or utilized. It implies a process of re-evaluation or re-examination, suggesting that the subject has the capability or potential to uncover or bring back to attention the object, which represents the information or facts that were set aside or overlooked.

Predicate-need_to_be.label: need to be
Predicate-need_to_be.description: The predicate 'need to be' expresses a requirement or necessity for the subject to possess a certain quality or characteristic represented by the object. It indicates that the subject is lacking in some way and that the object is essential for fulfilling a particular condition or achieving a desired state.

Predicate-are_of_little.label: are of little
Predicate-are_of_little.description: The predicate 'are of little' indicates that the subject has a minimal or insignificant amount of the quality or characteristic represented by the object. It suggests that the subject does not contribute meaningfully or effectively to the object, implying a lack of value, importance, or utility in relation to it.

Predicate-are_useful.label: are useful
Predicate-are_useful.description: The predicate 'are useful' serves to establish a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject possesses qualities or characteristics that provide benefit, utility, or value, as represented by the object. It implies that the subject contributes positively to a context or situation, making it advantageous or helpful in some way.

Predicate-presidentOf.label: presidentOf
Predicate-presidentOf.description: The predicate 'presidentOf' establishes a relationship between a person (the subject) and a nation or organization (the object), indicating that the person holds the position of president for that nation or organization. This implies a role of leadership, governance, and representation, where the subject is responsible for making decisions and leading the entity represented by the object.

Predicate-held_back_from.label: held back from
Predicate-held_back_from.description: The predicate 'held back from' indicates a relationship where the subject is prevented or restricted from engaging with, accessing, or utilizing the object. This implies a barrier or limitation that inhibits the subject's ability to fully participate in or benefit from the object in question.

Predicate-is_used_to_generate.label: is used to generate
Predicate-is_used_to_generate.description: The predicate 'is used to generate' indicates a functional relationship where the subject serves as a source or basis for the creation or formulation of the object. It implies that the subject provides the necessary information, context, or parameters that lead to the production of the object, which can be a result, output, or derived entity.

Predicate-is_asked.label: is asked
Predicate-is_asked.description: The predicate 'is asked' indicates a relationship where the subject is the entity that poses a question or request, while the object represents the content or subject matter of that inquiry. This connection implies that the subject seeks information, clarification, or a response regarding the object.

Predicate-tries_to_rank.label: tries to rank
Predicate-tries_to_rank.description: The predicate 'tries to rank' indicates an effort or attempt made by the subject to establish a hierarchy or order among the items represented by the object. It suggests a process of evaluation or comparison where the subject seeks to determine the relative importance, relevance, or quality of the entities within the set, ultimately aiming to organize them in a meaningful way.

Predicate-is_like.label: is like
Predicate-is_like.description: The predicate 'is like' establishes a comparative relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject shares similarities or characteristics with the object. It suggests a resemblance or analogy, allowing for the interpretation that the subject can be understood or conceptualized in a manner similar to the object.

Predicate-will_try_to_rank.label: will try to rank
Predicate-will_try_to_rank.description: The predicate 'will try to rank' indicates an intention or effort by the subject to establish a hierarchy or order among the items represented by the object. It suggests that the subject is actively engaging in a process of evaluation or comparison to determine the relative positions or statuses of the entities within the specified set.

Predicate-derive.label: derive
Predicate-derive.description: The predicate 'derive' indicates a relationship where the subject provides foundational principles, rules, or information that leads to the formation or extraction of the object. In this context, the subject serves as a source or basis from which the object is generated or inferred, highlighting a process of logical or conceptual progression.

Predicate-is_identified_even_when_there_.label: is identified even when there is
Predicate-is_identified_even_when_there_.description: The predicate 'is identified even when there is' establishes a relationship where the subject can be recognized or acknowledged despite the absence or lack of the object. It implies that the identification of the subject is possible under conditions that would typically hinder such recognition, suggesting resilience or robustness in the identification process.

Predicate-is_instantiated_by.label: is instantiated by
Predicate-is_instantiated_by.description: The predicate 'is instantiated by' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a concept, entity, or fact that is realized or exemplified through the object, which typically denotes a specific rule, model, or framework. This connection indicates that the object serves as a concrete representation or application of the subject, thereby providing a means to understand or operationalize the subject in a defined context.

Predicate-serve_as_input_to.label: serve as input to
Predicate-serve_as_input_to.description: The predicate 'serve as input to' indicates a functional relationship where the subject provides data, information, or resources that are utilized by the object for further processing, analysis, or decision-making. This implies that the subject is a precursor or a necessary component that enables the object to perform its intended task or function.

Predicate-is_an_entity_extant_in.label: is an entity extant in
Predicate-is_an_entity_extant_in.description: The predicate 'is an entity extant in' establishes a relationship between a subject and an object by indicating that the subject exists as a recognized or defined entity within the context or framework of the object. This implies that the subject has a presence or is acknowledged within the specified domain represented by the object, which could be a system, category, or collection of knowledge, such as knowledge graphs (KGs).

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: The predicate 'requires' establishes a relationship in which the subject is dependent on the object for its execution, completion, or fulfillment. It indicates that the subject cannot function or achieve its intended purpose without the presence or availability of the object.

Predicate-beyond.label: beyond
Predicate-beyond.description: The predicate 'beyond' indicates a relationship where the subject is positioned at a level or state that surpasses, transcends, or extends past the object. It suggests that the subject encompasses or includes aspects that are not limited to the object, implying a greater scope, depth, or complexity.

Predicate-introduce.label: introduce
Predicate-introduce.description: The predicate 'introduce' signifies the action of presenting or bringing something new into a context or discussion. In the context of the subject and object, it indicates that the subject is actively making the object known or accessible, often for the first time or in a new way. This can involve providing information, context, or relevance about the object to the audience or participants involved.

Predicate-require.label: require
Predicate-require.description: The predicate 'require' indicates a necessity or obligation where the subject needs or depends on the object to fulfill a certain condition, achieve a goal, or complete a task. It establishes a relationship of dependence, suggesting that the subject cannot proceed or succeed without the presence or provision of the object.

Predicate-extend.label: extend
Predicate-extend.description: The predicate 'extend' indicates a relationship where the subject enhances, elaborates on, or broadens the scope of the object. It suggests that the subject adds new dimensions, insights, or developments to the existing framework represented by the object, thereby creating a connection that signifies growth or progression in understanding or application.

Predicate-extends.label: extends
Predicate-extends.description: The predicate 'extends' indicates a relationship where the subject builds upon, elaborates, or continues the ideas, concepts, or findings represented by the object. It suggests a progression or enhancement of the object, implying that the subject adds new dimensions, insights, or developments to what has previously been established.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates an action where the subject introduces, showcases, or offers the object to an audience or context. It implies a transfer of information or a demonstration of the object, which can be a concept, method, or set of rules, thereby facilitating understanding or awareness of the object by the recipient.

Predicate-for_learning.label: for learning
Predicate-for_learning.description: The predicate 'for learning' indicates a purpose or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It suggests that the subject is designed, developed, or utilized to facilitate the acquisition of knowledge or skills pertaining to the object. In this context, the subject serves as a means or tool that aids in the understanding or mastery of the concepts represented by the object.

Predicate-are_a_different_form_to.label: are a different form to
Predicate-are_a_different_form_to.description: The predicate 'are a different form to' indicates a relationship of distinction between the subject and the object, suggesting that while both share a common domain or category, they represent alternative variations or types within that domain. This predicate emphasizes the uniqueness of the subject in comparison to the object, highlighting that they are not identical but rather serve different purposes or exhibit different characteristics within the same broader context.

Predicate-is_of.label: is of
Predicate-is_of.description: The predicate 'is of' establishes a relationship of belonging or association between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is characterized by, derived from, or related to the object in a significant way. It suggests that the subject possesses qualities, attributes, or elements that are defined or categorized by the object.

Predicate-is_effective_over.label: is effective over
Predicate-is_effective_over.description: The predicate 'is effective over' establishes a relationship where the subject demonstrates a capability or performance that yields positive results or outcomes when applied to the object. It implies that the subject is suitable or proficient in addressing, managing, or utilizing the object in a manner that achieves desired goals or solves relevant problems.

Predicate-is_effective_with.label: is effective with
Predicate-is_effective_with.description: The predicate 'is effective with' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject demonstrates a successful or beneficial performance when applied in conjunction with the object. This implies that the subject has a positive impact or yields favorable results in the context of the object, suggesting compatibility or synergy between the two.

Predicate-is_a_solution_to.label: is a solution to
Predicate-is_a_solution_to.description: The predicate 'is a solution to' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a method, approach, or technique that effectively addresses, resolves, or mitigates the challenges or issues described by the object. In this context, the subject is positioned as a viable answer or remedy to the problem articulated in the object, indicating that the subject has the capability to fulfill the needs or requirements posed by the problem.

Predicate-is_structured_as.label: is structured as
Predicate-is_structured_as.description: The predicate 'is structured as' indicates a relationship where the subject is defined or characterized by a specific arrangement, organization, or format represented by the object. It conveys that the subject possesses a particular structure or framework that can be described or outlined in the terms provided by the object.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates a relationship where the subject provides detailed information, characteristics, or explanations about the object. It signifies that the subject offers a representation or account that clarifies or defines the nature, properties, or context of the object.

Predicate-formalises.label: formalises
Predicate-formalises.description: The predicate 'formalises' indicates that the subject provides a structured, systematic, or official representation or definition of the object. It implies that the subject clarifies, codifies, or establishes the object in a way that makes it more precise or understandable, often within a specific context or framework.

Predicate-discusses.label: discusses
Predicate-discusses.description: The predicate 'discusses' indicates that the subject provides an examination, analysis, or commentary on the object, which typically involves presenting information, insights, or interpretations related to the object. This connection implies a communicative act where the subject elaborates on the details, implications, or significance of the object in a structured manner.

Predicate-is_used_in.label: is used in
Predicate-is_used_in.description: The predicate 'is used in' establishes a functional relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject serves a purpose or is applied within the context of the object. It implies that the subject is actively utilized or implemented in the processes, activities, or environments represented by the object.

Predicate-discuss.label: discuss
Predicate-discuss.description: The predicate 'discuss' indicates an exchange of ideas, opinions, or information between the subject and the object. It implies a communicative act where the subject engages in a dialogue or deliberation about the object, which represents a topic, concept, or issue being examined or analyzed. This interaction can involve presenting arguments, sharing insights, or exploring different perspectives related to the object.

Predicate-is_an_identifier_for.label: is an identifier for
Predicate-is_an_identifier_for.description: The predicate 'is an identifier for' establishes a relationship where the subject serves as a unique label or reference that denotes or signifies the object. This connection implies that the subject provides a means to recognize, distinguish, or refer to the object, which can be any entity such as a place, person, or concept. The identifier facilitates communication and understanding by allowing individuals to refer to the object in a clear and specific manner.

Predicate-via.label: via
Predicate-via.description: The predicate 'via' indicates a means or method through which a subject entity engages with or relates to a binary predicate, establishing a connection that highlights the process or pathway by which the subject achieves or experiences the action or state described by the predicate.

Predicate-is_an_RDF_triple.label: is an RDF triple
Predicate-is_an_RDF_triple.description: The predicate 'is an RDF triple' establishes a relationship that identifies the subject as a specific instance or example of the broader category defined by the object, which is an RDF triple. In this context, the subject is characterized as belonging to the class of RDF triples, indicating that it follows the structure and semantics of the Resource Description Framework (RDF) model, which consists of a subject, predicate, and object.

Predicate-is_the_set_of.label: is the set of
Predicate-is_the_set_of.description: The predicate 'is the set of' establishes a relationship where the subject is identified as a collection or grouping that encompasses all members or elements represented by the object. It indicates that the subject contains or includes the entirety of the object, thereby defining the subject in terms of the specific entities or items that make up the object.

Predicate-are_written_in_the_form.label: are written in the form
Predicate-are_written_in_the_form.description: The predicate 'are written in the form' indicates a relationship where the subject is expressed or represented in a specific structure or format, which is detailed by the object. This suggests that the subject takes on a particular configuration or arrangement that is defined by the characteristics of the object, thereby conveying information or meaning in a structured manner.

Predicate-is_represented_by.label: is represented by
Predicate-is_represented_by.description: The predicate 'is represented by' establishes a relationship where the subject is depicted, illustrated, or symbolized by the object. It indicates that the object serves as a representation, manifestation, or expression of the subject, conveying its meaning, characteristics, or essence in a different form or context.

Predicate-is_a_pair.label: is a pair
Predicate-is_a_pair.description: The predicate 'is a pair' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the object consists of two related components or elements. In the context of the example, it signifies that the knowledge graph (KG) is represented as a pair, where the object K is defined as a tuple containing two elements, E and F. This relationship highlights the dual nature of the object, emphasizing that it is composed of two interconnected parts that together form a complete entity.

Predicate-employ.label: employ
Predicate-employ.description: The predicate 'employ' indicates the action of utilizing or applying a particular method, tool, or resource (the object) by a subject in order to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. It signifies a relationship where the subject actively engages with the object to facilitate a process or function.

Predicate-expresses.label: expresses
Predicate-expresses.description: The predicate 'expresses' indicates a relationship where the subject conveys, represents, or communicates the essence, meaning, or content of the object. It suggests that the subject serves as a medium through which the object is articulated or made understandable.

Predicate-are_a_kind_of.label: are a kind of
Predicate-are_a_kind_of.description: The predicate 'are a kind of' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or category that falls under the broader classification represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject shares essential characteristics or properties with the object, thereby categorizing the subject within the conceptual framework defined by the object.

Predicate-have_no.label: have no
Predicate-have_no.description: The predicate 'have no' indicates the absence or lack of a certain quality, characteristic, or entity in relation to the subject. It connects the subject to the object by asserting that the subject does not possess or is not associated with the object in question. This construction emphasizes a negation, highlighting that the subject is devoid of the specified object.

Predicate-forms.label: forms
Predicate-forms.description: The predicate 'forms' indicates a relationship where the subject is responsible for creating, shaping, or establishing the object. It suggests that the subject provides the necessary components, conditions, or rules that lead to the existence or realization of the object. In this context, the subject actively contributes to the formation or configuration of the object, resulting in a defined entity or concept.

Predicate-consists_of.label: consists of
Predicate-consists_of.description: The predicate 'consists of' indicates that the subject is made up of, or is composed of, the elements represented by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is seen as a whole that is formed from the individual parts or components denoted by the object.

Predicate-are_between.label: are between
Predicate-are_between.description: The predicate 'are between' indicates a relational positioning of the subject in relation to the object, suggesting that the subject exists in an intermediary state or location that connects or separates the entities represented by the subject and object. It implies a spatial, conceptual, or categorical relationship where the subject serves as a link or boundary between the two entities denoted by the object.

Predicate-is_the_single_predicate_of.label: is the single predicate of
Predicate-is_the_single_predicate_of.description: The predicate 'is the single predicate of' establishes a direct relationship between a subject and an object, indicating that the subject uniquely serves as the sole predicate that describes or defines the object. This implies that there is a singular, definitive connection where the subject encapsulates the essence or characteristic of the object, without the presence of any other predicates that could alter or add to this relationship.

Predicate-are_predicates_of.label: are predicates of
Predicate-are_predicates_of.description: The predicate 'are predicates of' establishes a relationship between a set of subjects (P_1, ..., P_n) and an object (the body), indicating that the subjects serve as the predicates that describe or characterize the object. This connection implies that the subjects provide specific attributes, properties, or conditions that apply to the object, thereby defining or clarifying its nature or state.

Predicate-are_variables_in.label: are variables in

Predicate-adheres_to_the_architecture_of.label: adheres to the architecture of

Predicate-is_returned_as.label: is returned as
